2:10.race_name: Return Of The Flat At Navan Handicap
2:10.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Gegenpressing
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: 4-46 on turf, handles most ground, well-treated on old form but might need this run
runners.spotlight: 4-46 on turf; last three wins on soft but handles good ground; well-handicapped on best form but poor record first time out in previous seasons; others preferred.

quotes.race: Tote Never Beaten By SP Handicap
quotes.quote: Gegenpressing loves these summer tracks and all four of his wins have come right-handed. I thought he got there too soon but he held on and, with a bit of luck, he might pick up another one or two off the marks he'll be off - Patrick Harty, joint trainer.

runners.name: Hasiyna
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: AW winner, 0-10 on turf, fit from AW but wants soft ground, Stanhope more likely for yard
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; dual AW winner is 0-10 on turf; won off 49 over 6f at Dundalk in January; is fit from the AW but her best turf runs came on softer ground than this; stable holds better claims with Stanhope.

runners.name: Little Mi Mi
runners.comment: 0-6, best effort here over 5f on good off 1lb higher, claims if fit on reappearance
runners.spotlight: 0-6 but has shown ability; best run came over 5f (good) here last September when beaten just 1.5l into second of 15 off 54 and is 1lb lower now; this extended 5f should suit on the evidence of that effort; claims if she is fit for her seasonal reappearance.

runners.name: Akeela
runners.comment: 1-10 on turf, won off 1lb higher at Naas over 6f, may need this run on seasonal return
runners.spotlight: 1-10 on turf, the win coming last July over 6f at Naas (good) off 51; went close off the same mark at Cork over 7f in September; just 1lb higher now but she needed a few runs to hit top form last year.

runners.name: Happy Henry
runners.comment: 0-5 on the AW, no show in first two h'caps, switch to turf needs to transform
runners.spotlight: 0-5 on the AW; not much impact in three maidens or in first two handicaps; switch to turf needs to spark improvement; others appeal more.

runners.name: Stanhope
runners.comment: Veteran, four-time course winner, ground versatile, has gone well fresh, chance if fit
runners.spotlight: Likeable veteran loves it here, as is evidenced by his four course wins; versatile regarding ground and won for this rider here over 6f last May; lacks a run but has gone well fresh in the past and is on a competitive mark; chance if he is ready to rock for his return.

quotes.race: Safer Gambling Handicap
quotes.quote: Stanhope is a real stalwart. He was back down to a mark that he could win off. That's his second win, he likes it here and he likes that extended five. We'll have a chat about whether we take it into next year - John McConnell, trainer

quotes.race: Beauparc Handicap
quotes.quote: Stanhope was in good nick when I got him. He was a bit unlucky in the Rockingham when he was a bit ring-rusty and I was happy he was going to run a big race today - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Indaver Ireland Handicap
quotes.quote: Stanhope got an absolute peach of a ride. He's in great order. I've never run him beyond six but we might run him at Galway over seven and maybe come back to six for a premier handicap on Champions Weekend - Damian English, trainer.

quotes.race: Crowne Plaza Race & Stay Handicap
quotes.quote: Stanhope looks like he might be a really nice sprinter for up here over the winter. I thought he would need the run but he dug deep - Damian English, trainer.

quotes.race: 188Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Stanhope was so unlucky last year and he deserved that. He enjoyed the dig in the ground and the blinkers have helped him concentrate - Micky Quinn, trainer.

runners.name: Dark Willow
runners.comment: 0-8 on turf, didn't show enough on her comeback to make her of interest here
runners.spotlight: 0-8 on turf; should strip fitter for her comeback in a Curragh maiden but she didn't show enough to make her of interest here.

runners.name: Navorrosse
runners.comment: 3-38 on turf, last win over C&D on soft in 2023, may need this after break
runners.spotlight: 3-38 on turf; C&D winner on soft ground in October 2023, her last success; is 2lb lower here but her best form last season came over 7f; entitled to need this after a break; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Fermoy Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Navorrosse had a good run last time and they filled me with confidence beforehand. She's been unlucky on a couple of occasions and has been threatening to do something like that at home. She rode like a filly that could possibly be well handicapped. She handled the ground well but has form on quicker ground. I think she'd also get further so hopefully they'll have fun with her - Colin Keane, rider.

runners.name: Step Back In Time
runners.comment: 1-18 on turf, sole win came here over 6f and 3lb lower now, Keane up, could go well
runners.spotlight: 1-18 on turf, the win coming here on yielding ground off 47 over 6f in September 2023 and she's 3lb lower now; no joy last season but best runs came at this venue; had a pipe opener at Naas last month and Keane gets the leg up; could go well.

quotes.race: Simonstown Handicap
quotes.quote: Step Back In Time got away with it today over the stiff five, she probably wants six. She ground it out really well. She has not been running badly and came out of the Cork race very well - Chris Timmons, trainer.

runners.name: Lismacbryan Hill
runners.comment: No impact last season, much better at Bellewstown, place claims again if handles track
runners.spotlight: Not much sign of ability in five starts last year but has improved; best effort yet on latest off this mark at Bellewstown on Saturday when a 1.25l second over 5f (good); Chris Hayes keeps the faith and she has place claims again if handling this stiffer track.

2:40.race_name: Vintage Crop Raceday April 26th (C & G) Maiden
2:40.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Paint The Moon
runners.comment: 4yo showed promise over 1m on belated debut at Dundalk, has to give a lot of weight away
runners.spotlight: 4yo offered something to build on at Dundalk (1m) when 80-1 for his belated debut 11 days ago, staying on but still beaten 12l; this stiffer stamina test should suit but he has to carry a lot of weight.

runners.name: Beat The Devil
runners.comment: 2,500euros Estidhkaar colt, related to French winner, probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Estidhkaar colt cost 2,500euros as a yearling; sixth foal; closely related to French 1m1f-1m5f winner Moutraki; dam 6f/7f maiden (RPR 44), half-sister to US 1m Grade 1 winner River Boyne and useful 5f/6f winner Harome; probably best watched on debut.

runners.name: Brandon Creek
runners.comment: Promise on debut at the Curragh, gelded after poor Gowran effort, check the market
runners.spotlight: Promise on debut at the Curragh (1m, good) but failed to back that up at Gowran when last seen in September; has been gelded and is in good hands so worth a market check.

runners.name: Bungle Lichious
runners.comment: Bungle Inthejungle gelding, half-brother to a 7f winner (AW), probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Bungle Inthejungle gelding is a second foal; half-brother to 7f AW winner Dandy Lichious (RPR 71); dam 1m-1m2f winner (79), closely related to 7f 2yo Listed winner Titus Mills, out of unraced daughter of Fillies' Mile winner Aqaarid; probably best watched on racecourse bow.

runners.name: Cinammon Coco
runners.comment: 16-1 for both starts at the Curragh and midfield, needs to improve for better ground
runners.spotlight: 16-1 for both starts on easy ground at the Curragh at 1m-7f and finished midfield in both; could improve for better ground but will need to; Browne McMonagle prefers stablemate.

runners.name: Diego El Queso
runners.comment: Pleasing debut on testing ground at Naas, dam liked good ground, 1m should suit
runners.spotlight: Pleasing enough debut at Naas over 7f on soft to heavy ground last month, staying on after being short of room; different ground here but his dam won on good-good to firm and he should appreciate the extra furlong here; considered.

runners.name: Faro Island
runners.comment: Seventh in 1m maidens at Gowran and the Curragh last year, may be one for h'caps
runners.spotlight: Long odds and two seventh placed finishes in maidens at Gowran and the Curragh last year; will be of more interest when tackling handicaps.

runners.name: Highway Sixty One
runners.comment: 0-3, beaten 15.5l when 200-1 at Dundalk latest over 1m, oppose
runners.spotlight: 0-3 so far with two of those runs coming on turf; 200-1 and beaten 15.5l at Dundalk latest over 1m; opposable.

runners.name: Mississippi River
runners.owner: D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & M Tabor & Peter M Brant
runners.comment: Rated 85, well-bred and should strip fitter for Naas run last month, the one to beat
runners.spotlight: Rated 85 after four maiden runs; should strip fitter for his comeback at Naas (7f, soft to heavy) last month when his jockey lost an iron close to home; well-bred Lope De Vega colt sets a solid standard and looks the one to beat.

runners.name: Omni Man
runners.comment: Held by Mississippi River on Galway running last year, improve for ground and tongue tie
runners.spotlight: Beaten 6.75l on sole start at Galway last October (Mississippi River 5.5l ahead of him in second); bred to appreciate this sounder surface and could improve for the fitting of a tongue-tie; place claims.

runners.name: Radial Symmetry
runners.comment: No show at 66-1 on debut at the Curragh last month, up in trip, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Sent off at 66-1 for his debut at the Curragh last month and was always in rear; steps up in trip but may need more time on that evidence.

runners.name: Rubadub Dubh
runners.comment: No show on Dundalk debut at 25-1, Keane prefers stablemate, watch on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Never involved when 25-1 for his debut at Dundalk (10.5f) eleven days ago; Colin Keane prefers Diego El Queso; best watched down in trip on turf debut.

runners.name: Sonic Invader
runners.comment: Better effort on second start but still beaten 9.75l, unproven on good, best watched
runners.spotlight: Much better second time up when a 9.75l seventh of 17 in a 7f Curragh maiden (soft) at 125-1; this longer trip will suit on that evidence; unproven on good ground; probably best watched.

runners.name: Zahrann
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Night Of Thunder colt, pedigree suggests he may need further than this, watch on debut
runners.spotlight: Night Of Thunder colt is a fourth foal; half-brother to French 1m4f/1m5f winner Zaniyka (RPR 87); dam 1m2f-1m4f winner (inc Group 3; 103), out of 1m4f winning half-sister to Listed winners Zanughan (1m4f) and Zand (10.5f), is granddaughter of 1m4f winner; may need further in time; watch on debut.

3:10.race_name: Cusack Hotel Group Family Fun Day July 13th Handicap
3:10.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Star Harbour
runners.comment: Won three times last season, twice over 1m1f also over 1m4f, trip may stretch his stamina
runners.spotlight: 7-31 on turf on the Flat; has run well at Dundalk without winning; busy last season, winning three times, twice over 1m1f and also over 1m4f; now tackles this trip for the first time since fourth to Saturn at the Curragh last July; that rival is now 3lb better off; has a run under his belt, an ambitious Listed attempt in testing conditions at Naas.

quotes.race: Happy 60th Birthday To Ger Dunne Of Punchestown Race
quotes.quote: Star Harbour was running over a trip well short of his best. We had him entered at Chester last weekend but we took him out because of the ground and because this race was there for him - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Irish EBF Ragusa Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Star Harbour has been very consistent, he won a good one last year in the Racing League as well. He's a great horse. We were to go to Yarmouth for the Racing League but that could put him out of the ratings. if it does he could go to Galway - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Castleisland Rated Race
quotes.quote: Star Harbour got a top class ride. He is entered in the Galway Mile and if the handicapper isn't too hard on him he will go there instead of the Curragh on Sunday. He probably didn't quite stay at Down Royal but in time I think he will - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Royal County Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: We put blinkers on Star Harbour last time but he missed the break and got caught in behind. He has a lot of ability and he wasn't a cheap colt. We have castrated him as he was a bit of a boyo and wasn't giving us everything. We did feel he had a lot of ability and I said I'd run him in this even though we were a couple of pounds out of the handicap as he'd have a light weight on his back. He put it to bed fairly quickly. He'll be nice for a mile-and-a-half handicap at Galway or as regards closer plans I was talking about the Ulster Derby - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

runners.name: Bay Of Sanibel
runners.comment: Both wins have come over C&D, high in the ratings now following Listed fourth in France
runners.spotlight: Both wins have come over C&D, a maiden in 2023 and a handicap last May; also second in a 1m5f handicap here early last season; took a big climb in the ratings for finishing fourth in a Listed race at Saint-Cloud last October; highly tried in a Group 3 at the same venue on final start.

quotes.race: Cusack Hotel Group Family Fun Day July 13th Handicap
quotes.quote: Bay Of Sanibel was unlucky last time but she really ground it out here. The cheekpieces really helped her. We might try and find another handicap before we go into stakes company - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Safer Gambling Navan Maiden
quotes.quote: Bay Of Sanibel was very green the first day at the Curragh, poor Nathan Crosse had to push her the whole way, but she was much better in the way she jumped and travelled this time. They picked her up at the Arqana Sales in December and she only came to us in June. She's only learning her job. You can see how big she is and she's going to be a gorgeous filly next year. We were going to wait for a 1m4f maiden at the Curragh next week but the ground is probably going to be heavy and the ground was going to be more suitable here. She is going to be a lovely staying filly next year and hopefully she can mix it in stakes company - Kate Harrington, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She won a maiden at Navan over a mile and six furlongs in October and she's in good form. She'll start off in a handicap and hopefully go forward to get a bit of black type. 24-04-24

runners.name: Poetic Sound
runners.comment: Two wins from three starts, appeals as a type who could prosper over this trip this term
runners.spotlight: Promising fourth on debut at Killarney last July; won a 1m4f maiden on heavy at Roscommon on second start despite still looking a bit green; showed that he was maturing well when a 4l winner of a 1m4f Bellewstown conditions event in October; appeals as a type who could prosper over this trip (and possibly further) this term.

quotes.race: Kilsaran Race
quotes.quote: Poetic Sound is a gorgeous horse. He was lost halfway through at Roscommon last time but he travelled better today, so he's learning on the job. Hopefully we'll have one more run before we put him away and we'll look forward to next year with him. I'd say even a mile and six is his minimum trip. We could go to the November Handicap but we'll see if he's street smart enough for that - Ger Lyons, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: District Speciality Coffee Apprentice Maiden
quotes.quote: Poetic Sound is a nice horse. He has plenty of ability but he is still very raw and green. Once I got rolling up the straight though I thought I would get there. Once the penny dropped he ran on well - James Ryan, rider.

runners.name: Saturn
runners.comment: Won two from four last year including on seasonal debut, stays well, ground will suit
runners.spotlight: Progressive colt last season after winning a maiden at Dundalk at three; won two from four last year, including on seasonal debut; had Star Harbour back in fourth when winning over this trip at the Curragh in June; failed to reproduce that form in 1m4f race won by Star Harbour later that month; stays well, ground will suit.

quotes.race: Leopardstown Golf And Driving Range Handicap
quotes.quote: Saturn was only ready to start off today, it was an inadequate trip and he's only going to be better over 1m4f or 1m6f. The key to him was the ground, we wanted to get him started, the faster the better, he seems to skip off it. He could go for a 1m6f on Guineas' weekend at the Curragh - Shane Foley, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Now Racing Every Wednesday At Dundalk Maiden
quotes.quote: Saturn had a really good run at the Curragh the first day and we probably ran him on ground that was a little bit too soft for him the second day and Shane (Foley) got off him that day and said don't run him on that ground again and to step him up to 1m4f. We were short of options so we were forced into running him over 1m2f here and he was just caught for a bit of toe inside the last furlong. We sat and waited for this 1m4f maiden and Scott (McCullagh) said he did it very impressively and no problem stepping him up to 1m6f - Katie Harrington, assistant trainer, talking to RTV.

runners.name: Mo Ghille Mar
runners.comment: 2-14 on turf has won over just short of 1m4f, not certain to stay as far as this
runners.spotlight: Has been hurdling, respectable third of six behind Bacchanalian at Fairyhouse in January, well below that standard at Cork last month; failed to do herself justice on her AW debut at Dundalk in January; 2-14 on turf; has won over just short of 1m4f, not certain to stay as far as this.

runners.name: Mordor
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux
runners.comment: Won a maiden over this trip at Killarney last season, now a 126-rated juvenile hurdler
runners.spotlight: Fit from hurdling, not disgraced when eighth behind talented stablemate Wodhooh in the Martin Pipe; five of his six Flat runs were in Britain early in his career; looks capable of making an impact in staying handicaps based on his win in a maiden over this trip on quick ground at Killarney last July; good 5lb claimer aboard.

runners.name: Grappa Nonino
runners.comment: Restored to form when scoring over 2m at Dundalk a month ago, 3lb wrong but respected
runners.spotlight: Course maiden hurdle winner at Navan in March 2023; fair staying handicapper on turf (won twice in 2023); lost form after second of 17 over this trip at the Curragh last May; restored to form when scoring over 2m at Dundalk a month ago; 3lb out of the handicap, but unwise to rule out.

3:40.race_name: Enjoy Hospitality At Navan Racecourse Handicap
3:40.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Tudor Manor
runners.comment: Good 1m4f form at Dundalk last November recording a win and a second, fit from hurdling
runners.spotlight: In good form over 1m4f at Dundalk last November, notching a win and a second; fit from hurdling; 1-14 on turf, sole win gained over 1m4f at Leopardstown last May; fine effort over this trip when second at the Listowel festival.

runners.name: Churchwarden
runners.owner: Mighty Macs Synd, Ocallaghan, Herron, Dividebyfive Synd

prev_owners.owner: Mighty Macs Synd, O'Callaghan, Herron, Dividebyfive Synd
Mighty Macs Synd, O'Callaghan, Herron, Dividebyfive Synd

runners.comment: Winning hurdler, has run only four times on the Flat, plenty of weight here
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler; has run only four times on the Flat; finished in mid-field over this trip at last year's Galway festival on only handicap start.

runners.name: Duke Of Leggagh
runners.comment: Won twice over hurdles in February, suited by heavy ground, this may be too quick for him
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner; won back-to-back 2m handicap hurdles at Naas in February, pulled up over a longer trip at the same venue last month; mid-field in a 1m4f handicap at the Curragh ten days ago; suited by heavy ground, this may be too quick for him.

quotes.race: William Hill Keep Your Raceday Positive Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was ideal conditions for Duke Of Leggagh. He jumped a lot better today. I knew he had improved from the last day, but I didn't think he had improved that much. We'll probably go back to the Flat with him now and he really does like that ground - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duke Of Leggagh ran well last day and on his Flat form he was entitled to win that. Guts won it for him. We'll mix it between this and the Flat but he wants ground like that - Mick Mulvany, trainer

quotes.race: Bective Restaurant Handicap
quotes.quote: Duke Of Leggagh had to win today, trying to win going up 12lb was going to be hard, but he's a lovely horse in the making. It took a while for the penny to drop last year, but it did on his last run at Galway and he is improving all the time. Gary said he had a bit left - Mick Mulvany, trainer

runners.name: Imarajan
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Second in a handicap over this trip at the Curragh last October, fit from hurdling
runners.spotlight: Ex-Aga Khan; ended six-race Flat campaign for the Halford/Collins team last year with second in a handicap over this trip at the Curragh; has run respectably in two maiden hurdle outings for this stable.

runners.name: Scott Lang
runners.comment: 1-17 turf Flat record is a negative though he won over 2m at Dundalk in February
runners.spotlight: Down the field over hurdles at Limerick last week; 1-17 turf Flat record is a negative, though he won over 2m at Dundalk in February at the main expense of today's rival Inchiquin Maid.

quotes.race: Tote Guarantee On All Win Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: Scott Lang only travelled okay and got a nice lead. In behind horses, he wasn't really travelling but I just kicked him into the gap just to see what would happen and he picked up nicely. He put it to bed well - Luke McAteer, rider.

runners.name: Inchiquin Maid
runners.comment: Winner and second from three Dundalk runs for this stable, possibly a bit high now
runners.spotlight: Improved form on first two starts for this stable, landing 2m Dundalk handicap by 5l in December before finishing second to Scott Lang from 10lb higher in February; sixth last month in another 2m Dundalk event, with The Truant seventh and Scott Lang ninth.

runners.name: Viceregent
runners.comment: Won a C&D handicap in 2023 for Charles Byrnes, two poor hurdle runs for this stable
runners.spotlight: Won a C&D soft-ground handicap in October 2023 on his final run for Charles Byrnes; did not appear for 12 months and struggled in two races over hurdles for this stable last November.

runners.name: The Truant
runners.comment: Overall record (2-48) is not encouraging though he struck a good vein of form last summer
runners.spotlight: 1-26 over hurdles, 1-22 on Flat; overall record is not encouraging, but he struck a good vein of form (hurdles and Flat) last summer; recent fourth over hurdles at Limerick was respectable.

runners.name: Billie Frechette
runners.comment: Showed a good attitude when winning over 2m at Dundalk 11 days ago with Makaiah in third
runners.spotlight: Has improved gradually at Dundalk during the winter (placed twice over 1m4f in December) and was rewarded with victory in a 2m handicap 11 days ago; showed a good attitude and has a good chance of confirming form with third-placed Mafiah despite a 5lb rise; that run was prefaced by a decent hurdles run at Wexford.

runners.name: Jazz Forever
runners.comment: AW winner; 0-11 on turf, not at best at Dundalk in recent months, others preferred
runners.spotlight: AW winner; 0-11 on turf and not at best at Dundalk in recent months; down the field over hurdles at Limerick last week.

runners.name: Makaiah

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Lynne Lyons & Sean Jones & David Spratt

runners.comment: Far third behind today's rival Billie Frechette over 2m at Dundalk, place chance
runners.spotlight: Mild promise for Ger Lyons last season, though best run was over 1m in a claimer; by far the best of four hurdle runs when 66-1 second in six-runner Fairyhouse event; outstayed when third behind today's rival Billie Frechette over 2m at Dundalk 11 days ago.

runners.name: Bynx
runners.comment: Unplaced in 12 Flat starts, little apparent chance judged on recent hurdles form
runners.spotlight: Two win over hurdles, both at Tramore; unplaced in 12 Flat starts; little apparent chance on recent hurdles form, pulled up in two of her last three races.

quotes.race: Jimmy Shanahan Memorial Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: When in doubt, call Flanagan! He gave Bynx a masterclass of a ride and got the fractions spot on in that ground - Martin Hassett, trainer.

4:15.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 3yo Spring Series Median Auction Maiden
4:15.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Dakota Blue
runners.comment: Hold strong claims on juvenile form, second on either side of fourth behind a top prospect
runners.spotlight: Second in four-runner race at Tipperary on debut before fourth behind potential star The Lion In Winter in a 7f Curragh maiden in July; form also boosted by third-placed Ides Of March, and less emphatically by runner-up Currawood; beaten a head by the useful-looking Glenderry at Dundalk in October; has been gelded; should be hard to beat.

runners.name: Edelak
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Dam a 1m4f Group 3 winner for Dermot Weld, second-string for trainer of Dakota Blue
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to winners Emiyn, Edessan and Edzel; dam a 1m4f Group 3 winner for Dermot Weld, from the family of Gold Cup winners Enzeli and Estimate; second-string for trainer of Dakota Blue

runners.name: General Grant
runners.comment: Slowly away and never in contention over 1m at Gowran last week, more experience needed
runners.spotlight: Slowly away and never in contention over 1m at Gowran last week; will need to pick up more experience.

runners.name: God The Highness
runners.comment: From a top stable, not enough in the pedigree to encourage support first time out
runners.spotlight: First foal; unraced dam out of unraced half-sister to a winner and a French Listed-placed 1m winner; best watched

runners.name: Nobler
runners.comment: Placed on all three starts at two, trip should suit, rated 9lb inferior to Dakota Blue
runners.spotlight: Showed inexperience when third in a 7f Galway festival maiden on debut; slow starter when second to an Aidan O'Brien-trained favourite over 1m at Listowel maiden; beaten favourite when runner-up over 1m at the Curragh in October; this trip should suit.

runners.name: Palavar
runners.owner: David Brennan & Miss K Mcgivern & Ms J Morgan & Thomas Hore
runners.comment: Has shown some promise at Dundalk, stablemate Nobler has stronger credentials
runners.spotlight: Has shown some promise at Dundalk; stablemate Nobler has stronger credentials.

runners.name: Retrograde
runners.owner: Barry Fowler & Mrs A M Obrien & Kim Valerio
runners.comment: Half-brother to two winners, dam French AW/turf winner, trip should be within his range
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to winners El Picador and Weddell Sea; dam French AW/turf winner (94), half-sister to US Grade 2 winner Surya; pedigree suggests he will be suited by middle-distances.

runners.name: Treasure Planet
runners.comment: Dam Beach Of Falesa was a Flat and hurdles winner for Aidan O'Brien, yard's second-string
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; brother to winner Flat and hurdles scorer Isotope and Flat winner Flower Garland (1m AW; 78), half-brother to another winner Native Queen; dam Beach Of Falesa was a Flat and hurdles winner for Aidan O'Brien.

runners.name: Vorfreude
runners.comment: Showed enough in two runs at the Curragh last autumn to suggest he can win a maiden
runners.spotlight: Made an encouraging debut over 1m1f at the Curragh last September, sticking to his task well at odds of 80-1 having missed the break; confirmed ability when third over 1m at the same venue the following month.

runners.name: Invigorated
runners.comment: Last of 14 first time out at the Curragh ten days ago, safe to rule out
runners.spotlight: Last of 14 first time out at the Curragh ten days ago; safe to rule out.

runners.name: Princess Of Saxony
runners.owner: Team Valor International Llc & A Oliver
runners.comment: Beaten under 6l in two 1m maidens at Dundalk but needs to improve to feature here
runners.spotlight: Beaten under 6l in two 1m maidens at Dundalk but needs to improve to feature here.

runners.name: Woodlea
runners.comment: In rear in races over 7f at the Curragh and 1m at Naas, can be left out of calculations
runners.spotlight: In rear in races over 7f at the Curragh and 1m at Naas; can be left out of calculations.

4:50.race_name: Book Your Navan Summer BBQ Packages Apprentice Handicap
4:50.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Secret World

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: AW winner, 0-10 on turf, placed off 1lb higher at this trip, not discounted on stable bow
runners.spotlight: 1-3 on the AW for Charlie Johnston but 0-10 on turf, though she has run well in defeat; bought for 10,000gns at Tattersalls H-I-T Sale in October; has placed off 1lb higher over this trip on good ground; not discounted on stable and Irish debut.

runners.name: Tuba
runners.comment: Fine debut effort, soft ground and 1m4f maybe not ideal latest, should do better, chance
runners.spotlight: Ran a blinder when a 2.5l third of 9 on debut at Limerick (1m, good); soft ground and 1m4f may have conspired against him on his handicap bow and seasonal reappearance at the Curragh; could do better back in trip on this ground; claims.

runners.name: Yes Oui Si
runners.comment: 0-7 on turf, regressed since third in 1m4f Curragh maiden, headgear off, others preferred
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on turf; standout effort a 1.5l third of 10 in a 1m4f Curragh maiden (good) last June; regressed since and headgear worn for last three starts is discarded; others appeal more.

runners.name: Heliogabalus
runners.comment: Beaten favourite in a Ballinrobe claimer when last seen, watch on debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Best effort a 1l third of 13 in a 1m Dundalk maiden in October 2023; poor form last year and beaten 8l when 6-4 favourite in a Ballinrobe claimer on final start for Jessica Harrington last June; off since and best watched on first start for new yard.

stable_tour.quote: He's still a maiden and has done well over the winter. He progressed well to finish a good third at Dundalk and hopefully can win his maiden and go forward. 24-04-24

runners.name: Summer Snow
runners.comment: 3-20 on turf, won off 61 over 7f at Gowran, goes up in trip on debut for new yard, watch
runners.spotlight: 3-20 on turf; won off 61 over 7f at Gowran (good) last June and good effort when a 3l third at Leopardstown off 7lb higher a month later; has since left Michael O'Callaghan and steps up in trip for debut for new yard; probably best watched.

runners.name: Church Mountain
runners.comment: No turf win since July 2023, poor last three runs at Dundalk, others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Won back to back 10.5f handicaps at Dundalk last October off 60 and 65; 4-39 on turf, his last win coming off 73 in July 2023; is 7lb lower here but his last three runs at Dundalk were below par; others appeal more.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen Your Odds Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain has taken a while to come around to our way of thinking but we got him started at Leopardstown a couple of weeks ago and ran a lovely race. It gave us confidence to drop him in because he's won his other races for Denis Hogan making it. He looked like he won snug enough at the line so hopefully he'll be able to go to Galway and be competitive - Michael O'Callaghan, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Limerick Racecourse Handicap
quotes.quote: You'd call stall 18 a bad draw usually, but not with Church Mountain because he doesn't like traffic around him. If he's drawn low and misses the break, it can be hard for him to get going, but Dan is super value for his 7lb claim off those weights. This horse has won twice at Galway and hopefully will go back there. Even though he's a big horse, he seems to like good ground - Denis Hogan, trainer

quotes.race: James P. Cunningham Electrical Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain picked up well and did everything for me today. I'd say he's going to make a lovely dual purpose horse, he won't be a horse until next year - Joey Sheridan, jockey.

quotes.race: Kenny Galway Volvo Handicap
quotes.quote: Church Mountain is one we always liked, but he's a massive horse and still not the finished article. He was green in front but he needed to be there because he is a 1m2f horse. Making the running was the making of him - Denis Hogan, trainer.

runners.name: Out On Friday
runners.comment: 7-68 on turf, 2lb below last win at Roscommon but may need this run after a break
runners.spotlight: 7-68 on turf; is 2lb below his latest win at Roscommon (10.5f, good) last July; has tended to need his comeback runs in the past.

quotes.race: Ardmore Handicap
quotes.quote: Out On Friday was stepping back in trip, which suited him as all he does is stay. He loves to get his own way in front and can go on any ground - Sean Bowen, jockey, speaking on Racing TV

quotes.race: BOYLESPORTS Supporting Irish Racing Handicap
quotes.quote: Out On Friday got a lovely ride from Killian. He has come back to form and you have to take the opportunities when you get them. There's a race at Galway next month which might suit him - Philip Byrne, trainer.

quotes.race: Caulfield Industrial Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Out On Friday is a tricky ride and has his own ideas. He didn't like going left-handed at Leopardstown last week and loved going right-handed here. He's in again on Sunday and we might take our chance - Philip Byrne, trainer.

runners.name: Seti
runners.comment: 7f AW maiden winner, hasn't flourished in h'caps, tongue tie and blinkers now tried
runners.spotlight: 1-7 on the AW and 0-2 on turf; no success since 7f maiden win at Dundalk in November 2023; hasn't made much impression in handicaps and a tongue tie and blinkers are now tried; others hold more pressing claims.

runners.name: Purple Sky
runners.comment: 0-7 on turf, promise off 2lb lower over 1m at Gowran, bred to stay this far, interesting
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on turf; ran well in second handicap when beaten just 1.75l into fourth of 15 at Gowran (1m, good) in September and is 2lb lower now; bred to stay this far and jockey booking catches the eye; interesting on seasonal reappearance.

runners.name: Rain
runners.comment: Winless since French maiden victory in 2022, new yard, trip a concern, best watched
runners.spotlight: 1-25 on turf; won a French 14.5f 3yo fillies maiden in 2022 when trained by Andre Fabre; failed to add to that tally for James Barcoe and has now moved to another new yard; this trip looks too sharp and she is best watched after a break.

runners.name: Hurricane Helen
runners.comment: Dual AW winner, 5-26 on turf, fit from AW but 3lb above last win, place claims
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner is 5-26 on turf; latest win came off 60 at Cork last August (1m1f, good to firm); is fit from the AW and knows how to win but she's 3lb above her last winning mark; place claims.

quotes.race: Free Tips Daily On attheraces.com Classified Stakes
quotes.quote: Hurricane Helen did it nicely. I think there's still a bit of improvement there. I loved the way she travelled into the race but inside the final furlong she was still a bit green and having a good look at everything. I'd be hopeful there's more to come - Ross Coakley, jockey.

runners.name: Step To Somewhere
runners.comment: 0-4 on turf, went close off 1lb higher on h'cap bow at Clonmel, yard in form, considered
runners.spotlight: Seven race maiden is 0-4 on turf; went close off 63 on handicap debut at Clonmel last September (9.5f, good), staying on well, and is 1lb lower now; returns from a break with her yard in form and the tongue tie worn last time at Dundalk is left off; considered.

runners.name: Barretstown
runners.comment: Three-time AW winner, won off 51 at Cork last May, may be on a tough mark for now
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner is 1-27 on turf; in decent form at Dundalk at the backend of last year, winning off 57 over 10.5f; turf win came over this trip at Cork off 51 and he is 10lb higher; may be on a tough mark for now.

quotes.race: Racing Again June 14th Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: He jumped out well, travelled well and never got hassled for the lead. Barretstown was doing an even enough gallop, took breathers when he could and kept responding. It's good when you have a willing partner like that - Billy Lee, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Harseva
runners.comment: 0-6 on turf, good C&D run off 1lb higher last year, hooded, good jockey booked, go well
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on turf but has shown she is capable of winning a race; promise in first two handicaps, including over this C&D when a 2l third of 17 off 55 and is 1lb lower now; good jockey booked, hood goes on and she could go well on first start for Patrick Magee.

5:20.going_detailed: GOOD (Good to firm in places; watered)

runners.name: Glinka
runners.comment: Handicap debutant, minor promise on debut, potential improver, check the market
runners.spotlight: One of five for yard; handicap debutant; minor promise on debut over 1m at Dundalk but only beat one rival home the next twice when long odds; could improve but needs to; check the market.

runners.name: All Right By Me
runners.comment: Promise on debut and on h'cap bow at Dundalk last month, not bred for this step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in strong 6f Curragh maiden on debut when 4l behind Henri Matisse; promise on handicap debut at Dundalk over 1m off this mark last month in first-time blinkers (retained) and should strip fitter, though his pedigree suggests he's not certain to stay this far.

runners.name: Booklight
runners.breeder: Mount Coote Stud And M H Dixon
runners.comment: H'cap debutante, potentially well-treated on debut form, steps up in trip, check market
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante; showed potential in two of her three maiden runs at 6f and 1m on good ground; could be well treated on the form of her debut and there's stamina on the dam side of her pedigree; check the market.

runners.name: Angelo Pio
runners.comment: Best effort on second start at Dundalk at 1m, dam won at this trip, market informative
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; best of three AW efforts on second start when staying on for a 4.5l fourth at Dundalk; now makes handicap and turf debut; dam won at this trip and the market should tell plenty.

runners.name: Palmezzano
runners.comment: H'cap debutant, mild promise over 1m-10.5f at Dundalk, monitor the market
runners.spotlight: Third runner for yard; mild promise in final two qualifying runs at Dundalk over 1m and 10.5f; not obviously well-treated for handicap debut but is worth monitoring in the market.

runners.name: Antoine De Paris
runners.comment: H'cap debutante, beaten 4l in AW claimer latest, bred to stay this trip, not discounted
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutant; beaten 4l in a 7f Dundalk claimer on latest in November; pedigree suggests this step up in trip might suit and his yard has been amongst the winners; not discounted.

runners.name: Junkyard Dog
runners.comment: The choice of McMonagle, promise on turf on and on AW on h'cap debut, trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Fourth runner for yard and the choice of Browne McMonagle; displayed promise on second start at Naas (1m, good to yielding); shaped like further would suit that day and on handicap debut at Dundalk (1m) and is 2lb lower here; interesting upped in trip.

runners.name: Sottsands
runners.comment: All four starts on AW at 7f-10.5f, opening mark fair, rider claims useful 7lb, considered
runners.spotlight: One of two for yard; all four starts on the AW in January and February at 7f-10.5f; dam related to turf winners and opening mark looks fair; worth considering with rider taking off 7lb.

runners.name: Live Like The Boss
runners.owner: John G Hennessy & C Acheson & Mrs John Harrington
runners.comment: Not much promise last season, half-sister to useful winners could improve on h'cap bow
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante didn't show much in three outings last season at around 7f on good and yielding ground; half-sister to two useful winners so should be capable of better at some point; keep an eye on the market.

runners.name: Ice Jet
runners.comment: Long odds and well-beaten in maidens, has been gelded, up in trip on h'cap bow, watch
runners.spotlight: Long odds and no impact in three turf maidens at 1m on good and soft ground last season; has been gelded and now steps up in trip for handicap debut; probably best watched.

runners.name: One Of A Kind
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: H'cap debutante, didn't show much in maidens, bred to do better, worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Handicap debutante; not many positives to take from three maiden runs at 7f to 1m last year; cheekpieces now tried; bred to do better and should appreciate this trip; worth a market check.

runners.name: Baila Conmigo
runners.comment: Long odds and well-beaten in maidens, up in trip for h'cap debut, probably best watched
runners.spotlight: Long odds and well-beaten both starts last year on good and yielding at 6f-7f; similar outcome on seasonal reappearance at Naas last month (7f, soft to heavy); probably best watched upped in trip in first handicap.

runners.name: Your Call
runners.owner: Mrs Caroline Hendron & Mrs M Cahill & Ciaran Kennelly
runners.comment: Won a 7f h'cap on the AW in December, trip a query, vulnerable to less exposed types
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; 0-8 on turf but won a 7f handicap on the AW off 59 in December; not beaten far back there over 1m on return from an 86-day break last month; mixed messages in pedigree regarding this longer trip and may be vulnerable against less exposed rivals.

runners.name: Johnnys Oasis
runners.comment: Mild promise second start at Dundalk, visor on for h'cap debut, worth a market check
runners.spotlight: Second runner for yard; mild promise in second maiden start at Dundalk (1m); not as good upped to 10.5f for final qualifying run; visor now applied for handicap bow; check the market.

runners.name: Blondina
runners.comment: Long odds but promise last two maidens, dam won at this trip, h'cap debut, could improve
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure odds for last two maiden starts at Naas (6f) and Gowran (7f) but they weren't devoid of potential; dam won over this trip (RPR 97); looks a potential improver on handicap debut.

runners.name: Real Petite
runners.comment: Promise on debut on AW, beaten 17l latest on soft, bred to stay, h'cap bow, check market
runners.spotlight: Not too bad an effort on debut at Dundalk in January (1m) but hasn't built on that; beaten 17l in a Curragh maiden (7f, soft) on seasonal reappearance last month; bred to stay this trip; market check is advised on handicap debut.

runners.name: Elvetham
runners.comment: No impact in maidens or h'cap debut at Dundalk, gelded, hood goes on, best watched
runners.spotlight: No impact in a trio of turf maidens on good to yielding and heavy last year; visor didn't spark much improvement on handicap debut at Dundalk (7f) in February; gelded and hood is now tried; yard going well but probably best watched.

runners.name: Buck Barrow
runners.comment: 0-7, shaped like this trip might suit last year, been gelded, go well if fit after break
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on turf; shaped like this sort of trip might suit when staying on for a 2.75l fifth at Down Royal on handicap debut over 7f (good) and again when fifth on softer ground at Gowran (7f) when last seen in October; has been gelded; could go well if he's fit after a break.

runners.name: Coulstys Way
runners.comment: 2lb lower than when a staying on fourth at Bellewstown over 1m, hooded, outrun odds if fit
runners.spotlight: Showed ability second time up at Roscommon (7.5f, good); stayed on well for a 4l fourth on handicap debut off 54 at Bellewstown (1m, yielding) and 2lb lower now; heavy ground not ideal at Galway latest; promising claimer takes off 7lb and hooded; could outrun her likely odds if fit.

runners.name: Let Her Cook
runners.comment: No show at big prices in three maidens, upped in trip for h'cap bow, may need more time
runners.spotlight: Triple figure odds and never figured in a trio of maidens at 7f-8f on good-good to yielding; related to winners so could improve upped in trip on handicap debut but she may need more time.

1:30.going_detailed: POLYTRACK: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO SOFT

runners.name: Caro Buono
runners.owner: Mark Tronco, Steven Robert Collins & Stephen Swift

runners.name: Radiant
runners.owner: Lnj Foxwoods, Michael Kramek Et Al

runners.name: Zelzara
runners.owner: Mme Julie Mestrallet, Mme Peggy Blondel Et Al

runners.name: Lieberose
runners.breeder: Franklin Finance S A & Mme S Nigge

2:05.going_detailed: POLYTRACK: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO SOFT

runners.name: Woodshauna
runners.comment: Won 6.5f AW Listed event at Chantilly in good style last month; one of the likelier types
runners.spotlight: Improved from his debut here to win on his second outing, again at this venue but on the AW; already had two starts this year and comes into this having won a 6.5f AW Listed event at Chantilly in good style, from a horse who has won since and runs in the Prix Imprudence; holds obvious claims if able to translate his improved form to grass.

runners.name: Arabie
runners.comment: Group 2 winner in France as a 2yo who has solid claims if staying this trip on return
runners.spotlight: Won a couple of French Group races as a 2yo at Chantilly, most notably the Group 2 Prix Robert Papin, and matched that level when fourth in the Group 1 Prix Morny here after; obvious claims if staying the extra furlong on this return to action, with his pedigree suggesting he could.

quotes.race: Prix Robert Papin (Group 2) (2yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: That was brilliant, I'm delighted. Arabie has a lot of ability but he's very idle, very lazy. He does only what you ask him. But his homework has definitely improved from his last run going into this one and I was pretty bullish that he'd run a big race. I thought it would take a good horse to beat him. He was a little bit slowly away, he stood in the stalls for a while and I was a bit worried for a second or two, but Jim [Crowley, jockey] is very experienced and got him off the rail and round. I actually expected him to be under pressure a little bit earlier than he was. He'll go to the Prix Morny  and he'll run very well in it - Karl Burke, trainer.

runners.name: Dynamitic
runners.comment: No doubts about him staying this trip but need more to play a part in the finish
runners.spotlight: Successful in two of his three runs and was tried over 1m2f at a 2yo; made a good start to his 3yo campaign at Marseille Borely last month on very soft over 1m 110yds having pulled his way to the front, but this will demand a significant step up in form; holds an entry in the Poulains (French 2000 Guineas).

runners.name: Rosapenna
runners.owner: Ian Douglas Highet & Haras De Bourgeauville

prev_owners.owner: Ian Douglas Highet & Mrs Robert G Ehrnrooth

runners.comment: Lots to find on the figures; has 2.25l to find with Woodshauna on their clash last month
runners.spotlight: Two time winner over winter in AW events at up to a mile, including here, but has 2.25l to find with Woodshauna on their clash last month; entered in the Poulains.

runners.name: Tiego The First
runners.comment: Ran with credit in a couple of Group races last back end but needs a career best today
runners.spotlight: Twice a winner as a juvenile, the second of them coming over this track (but round course) in a Listed event before performing with credit in better races after a two month break; should run well but a bit to find; holds an entry in the Poulains.

runners.name: Maranoa Charlie
runners.breeder: Haras D'Etreham, Riviera Equine Sarl & Gestut Zur Kuste Ag
runners.owner: Peter Maher, Carl Fitzgerald & John Baxter
runners.comment: Needs to bounce back from last effort but looked sensational before that; leading chance
runners.spotlight: Looked sensational on his first three starts at up to a mile (won on debut over this C&D) but blew out when odds-on favourite for the Group 1 Criterium International when last seen; not difficult to forgive that effort and give the son of Wootton Bassett another chance, with a hood going on today, with there being no concerns about his stamina; entered in the Poulains.

quotes.race: Prix Thomas Bryon Jockey Club de Turquie (Group 3) (2yo) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I don't think I've ever trained a horse like Maranoa Charlie, one with his desire to run and who can take the others on like that. He gets better with every run and I don't know what his limits are. The plan is to go to the Criterium International and that was the perfect preparation - Christopher Head, trainer.

runners.name: Le Roi Rene
runners.breeder: T De La Heronniere & Salabi Racing

prev_owners.owner: Salabi Racing, Nuri Ozdogan Et Al

runners.comment: This is a big step up but is race fit and has Oisin Murphy on for the first time
runners.spotlight: Only made his debut in January, and built on that run to win a 7.5f heavy-ground maiden at Cagnes-Sur-Mer in early February; this is a much tougher task but the booking of Oisin Murphy clearly catches the eye.

runners.name: Silius
runners.comment: Far more exposed than his rivals but looks improved this year and has a Group 1 pedigree
runners.spotlight: Comfortably has the most experience of these and went 3-3 at Cagnes-Sur-Mer earlier this year, which included a Listed success last time over 7.5f, from a horse who then finished second to Woodshauna; bred to be a Group horse and is improved this year, so has to be respected with race-fitness on his side; entered in the Poulains.

3:15.going_detailed: POLYTRACK: STANDARD; TURF: GOOD TO SOFT

runners.name: Ghoufrann
runners.comment: Useful sort but has over 5l to find with Better Together on AW form last year
runners.spotlight: Gained a first win on her third start (here on the AW in December), this having been over 5l behind Better Together in an AW Listed event (also here) prior to that; entitled to have improved over the winter but will need to have; entered in the Pouliches (French 1000 Guineas).

runners.name: Fraise Des Bois
runners.breeder: Mme C Vitse, Mme A Vitse Et Al
runners.comment: Multiple winner as a 2yo who reached a very useful level; respected
runners.spotlight: Stood plenty of racing as a 2yo, winning her first four and then matching the same level as her 7l Listed success La Teste De Buch when beaten in two Group events after, one of them coming in the C&D Prix du Calvados; has a solid profile and fully respected; entered in the Pouliches.

runners.name: Lhakpa
runners.owner: Everest Racing, Qatar Racing Limited & Mme Barbara M Keller

prev_owners.owner: Everest Racing, Qatar Racing Limited & Mme Barbara M Keller

runners.comment: Capable of very useful form but not at her best at Meydan this year; something to prove
runners.spotlight: Two time winner last year (once here over 7.5f) and ran with credit in the Group 1 Marcel Boussac after before a career-best in a Group 3 on heavy next time, albeit beaten by Mimos; wasn't anywhere close to her peak levels at Meydan this year so has something to prove returning to France; entered in the Pouliches.

runners.name: Kaadi
runners.comment: Capable of very useful form and can place, but stable also run Daylight
runners.spotlight: Having her 17th start today, and while capable of good very useful form (four seconds in Listed races and another second in a Group 3), the same connections run Daylight, who looks to have achieved more and is open to improvement; could place but others more fancied for win purposes; entered in the Pouliches.

runners.name: Daylight
runners.breeder: Ecurie Haras Du Cadran & P Van Belle
runners.comment: Has a leading chance on the figures and should get the trip
runners.spotlight: Progressed quickly from her winning debut and won the Group 3 Prix de Cabourg here over 6f on just her third run; she matched that level in the Morny (again here) after before a second in the Cheveley Park Stakes and then second again in the Criterium de Maisons-Laffitte on her final start as a juvenile; leading chance if she's trained on as bred to get this trip; entered in the Pouliches and Diane (French Oaks).

quotes.race: Sumbe Prix Morny (Group 1) (2yo Colts & Fillies) (Straight Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I'm a little bit disappointed. Obviously this is a very high-class field and Daylight hasn't been able to fight for the win. We had a bad draw and we then had to wait until it was too late for the gap to appear. She was very calm before and after the race and I think she's the best sprinting juvenile filly in Europe. She'll head to Cheveley Park at Newmarket and, despite the circumstances, with the way she flew home you've all been able to see she's a filly of great talent - Pauline Chehboub, owners' representative.

runners.name: Mimos
runners.comment: Holds a couple of these on Group 3 form at the end of last season; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Won second-time up at Le Lion-D'Angers over 7f and then progressed from that to finish her 2yo campaign with a win over Lhakpa and Iron Bird in the Group 3 Prix Miesque; more needed against some of these unless they under-perform but certainly not ruled out; entered in the Pouliches.

runners.name: Better Together
runners.comment: Only ever raced here, including at this trip on the AW; nicely bred and in the mix
runners.spotlight: Bred to be smart and has run all her races at this track, shedding her maiden status on her second start (over 6f) before winning a 7f Listed event on the Polytrack, a race in which Ghoufrann was fifth; open to plenty more improvement and can be in the mix for a place at least; entered in the Pouliches and Diane.

runners.name: Relaxx
runners.owner: Stars Of Fortune, Ecurie Jml Racing & Fletcher Michelet
runners.comment: Finished last season posting figures below her best; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Elevated in class after her 3l win in a conditions race at Chantilly (7f, good to soft) in June but didn't go on from her third in a Group 3 Prix Six Perfections here over 7f but on the round course; others preferred; entered in the Pouliches and Diane.

runners.name: Iron Bird
runners.comment: Displayed improved form on debut for new trainer recently; has to be respected
runners.spotlight: Smart sort who has met a few of these before and generally ran to a consistent level, however, displayed improved form when second on debut for this trainer on 3yo reappearance in a mile Listed event at Saint-Cloud behind a classy type, so has to be respected with race-fitness on her side; entered in the Pouliches.

runners.name: River Thames
runners.owner: Winstar Farm Llc, Chc Inc Et Al
runners.comment: More on his plate this time but should give it a bold bid.
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced (running for just the fourth time); has won two of his three career runs; second over 1mÂ½f at Gulfstream Park in the Fountain of Youth Stakes five weeks ago; this looks tougher but in with a chance.

runners.name: Render Judgment
runners.owner: Baccari Racing Stable, Dream Walkin Farms Inc Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Baccari Racing Stable, Dream Walkin Farms Inc & MJM Racing

runners.comment: This represents a step up in class so he can be taken on.
runners.spotlight: Solid effort when 20-1 runner-up at Colonial Downs last month in a Grade 3; encouraging jockey booking; may have to settle for supporting role as facing a tougher assignment this time.

runners.name: Burnham Square
runners.comment: This represents a step up in class so others more likely.
runners.spotlight: Far from disgraced in the Fountain of Youth Stakes when close behind River Thames at Gulfstream Park five weeks ago; has chalked up two wins from his last three; others are preferred with more demanding test in store.

runners.name: Owen Almighty
runners.owner: Flying Dutchmen Breeding And Racing Llc
runners.comment: More on his plate this time but likely to be in contention.
runners.spotlight: Successful by 3Â½l (Tampa Bay Downs) four weeks ago in a Grade 3; winner of three of his six career starts; poses a threat despite moving up in class.

runners.name: Chancer Mcpatrick
runners.comment: This represents a step up in class but has to be taken seriously.
runners.spotlight: A winner of a and three from five in his career so far; was on the premises (second, beaten 3Â½l) 31 days ago behind Owen Almighty at Tampa Bay Downs in a Grade 3; has to be considered despite moving up in class.

9:48.race_name: Resolute Racing Madison Stakes (Grade 1) (4yo+ Fillies & Mares) (Main Track) (Dirt)

runners.name: Positano Sunset
runners.breeder: John Seiler, Randy Bloch Et Al
runners.owner: Six Column Stables Llc, Randall L Bloch Et Al
runners.comment: This demands more than last time so makes little appeal.
runners.spotlight: Got the job done in a handicap by 1l at Tampa Bay Downs last month; has won here before; wins achieved at a lower level; with more on her plate can be taken on.

runners.name: Emery
runners.comment: Easy to see her making an impression despite having more on her plate.
runners.spotlight: Went down by a head in January (Gulfstream Park) behind Mystic Lake in a Grade 2; a C&D winner; won a Grade 2 in October here; form of the trainer is a plus; she should go close given her record when fresh and this step up in class unlikely to hinder her.

runners.name: Harbor Springs
runners.comment: Facing a tougher assignment than last time, looks risky.
runners.spotlight: Record shows she knows where the winning post is (wins-runs record of 3-11) but wins have come at a lower level; scored by a slim margin in an allowance optional claimer (Fair Grounds) 45 days ago; facing a tougher assignment than last time, one to tread carefully with.

runners.name: My Mane Squeeze
runners.owner: William J Butler & Winstar Farm Llc

runners.name: Dazzling Move
runners.comment: Concern she might not be fully tuned up so others appeal more.
runners.spotlight: Got home in front by three-quarters of a length in a Grade 3 at Gulfstream Park on first outing for new trainer 52 days ago; has achieved four wins from 15 career runs but has never won a race of this value; workout history raises concerns this race may be needed so one to tread carefully with.

runners.name: Justique
runners.comment: She's an attractive contender despite this step up in class.
runners.spotlight: Gained a just over 3l success in an allowance optional claimer (Fair Grounds) on first run for current trainer on New Year's Day; successful four times from 17 career runs; up in class but likely to be involved.

runners.name: Mystic Lake
runners.owner: C2 Racing Stable Llc & Stefania Farms Llc
runners.comment: This represents a step up in class but must be respected.
runners.spotlight: Career record shows her ability to win (wins-runs record of 7-14) and attempts to land a hat-trick; landed a narrow success in a Grade 2 (Gulfstream Park) in January; one to consider despite having more on her plate - goes well fresh.

runners.name: Run Carson
runners.comment: This represents a step up in class but in with a chance.
runners.spotlight: On target three times in his last six outings; a stakes winner six months ago; creditable effort to finish runner-up over 6f at Turfway Park (stakes) in December; up in class but in with a chance.

runners.name: Our Shot
runners.owner: Gatsas Stables, Steven Schoenfeld & John P Terranova Ii
runners.comment: More on his plate this time but has a competitive shout.
runners.spotlight: Almost victorious in a stakes in September; a disappointing result (went off favourite) when beaten 3l over 5f at Tampa Bay Downs (stakes) 45 days ago; entitled to respect despite this step up in class and jockey does well from inner gates here.

runners.name: Arzak
runners.comment: Encouragement to be gleaned from latest effort so in with big shout.
runners.spotlight: Favourite and just beaten at Gulfstream Park over 5f (stakes) behind Coppola four months ago; a winner over C&D; has maintained his consistent level of form; big chance as latest run was an encouraging one and he goes well fresh.

quotes.race: Dukhan Sprint (Local Group 3) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: That was marvellous. Mickael [Barzalona, jockey] did well to drop Rogue Lightning out early from his draw and everything went well. He came through the horses smoothly - Tom Clover, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Scarbrough Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: We put Rogue Lightning in the Abbaye and if he's okay we'll go there. I've always really liked him and he's very fast - Tom Clover, trainer.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Shergar Cup Dash (Handicap)
quotes.quote: Rogue Lightning is a really nice horse and it was very sporting of the owners to come to a race like this. I think we'll perhaps look at something like the Scarborough Stakes at Doncaster next. He won well there last time and hopefully looks like he's worth a crack at stakes company now. He showed plenty of talent as a 2yo but bringing him back to 5f with a hood has really helped and he's relaxed and grown up - Tom Clover, trainer.

quotes.race: Samantha Glendinning Takepayments Handicap
quotes.quote: Gelding him, applying the hood and and the drop back to five furlongs seems to have helped him just relax a bit. Carrie Browning rides him every day and she also rides Rogue Millennium. She's got him back fit and deserves a lot of the credit. Rogue Lightning has always been a horse with lots of ability and it's nice to see him show some of his full potential today - Tom Clover, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He did well last year winning over 6f at the Newmarket July Course before finishing second next time out in 6f Listed company at Newbury. He is showing plenty of speed and not getting home so I am looking to dropping him back to 5f soon. I hope he can win some more horses this year as he is a horse I have always liked. Hopefully having been gelded now he will return in much better form. 06-07-23

runners.name: Valentine Candy
runners.owner: L William Heiligbrodt, Corinne Heiligbrodt Et Al
runners.comment: This represents a step up in class but should give it a shot.
runners.spotlight: Narrow success in a stakes (Mahoning Valley) in November; seeking a hat-trick today and career record shows his ability to win (wins-runs record of 8-15); returns from a layoff here; first run on turf; more on his plate this time but rates a likely contender.

runners.name: No Nay Hudson
runners.owner: Andrew Farm & For The People Racing Stable Llc
runners.comment: This demands more than last time so one to tread carefully with.
runners.spotlight: Has maintained his consistent level of form but yet to win a race of this value; finished fourth but only beaten just over 1l 52 days ago (Fair Grounds) in a stakes; facing a tougher assignment than last time, looks an unlikely winner.

runners.name: Eamonn
runners.comment: This demands more than last time so may have to settle for supporting role at best.
runners.spotlight: Big price (10-1) when winning Gulfstream Park stakes four weeks ago; proven that he knows how to get his head in front (seeking a ninth win); others more likely as facing tougher company.

runners.name: Petcoff
runners.comment: Faces a tougher assignment this time so looks an unlikely winner.
runners.spotlight: Scored by just over 2l at Fair Grounds four weeks ago in an allowance optional claimer; has chalked up three wins from his last four; yet to win a race of this value; this demands more than last time so makes little appeal.

runners.name: Mischievous Rogue

prev_owners.owner: Paradise Farms Corp, David Staudacher & Jp Racing Stable

runners.comment: With more on his plate unlikely to do better than a supporting role.
runners.spotlight: Not beaten that far in fourth (4Â½l) over 6f at Turfway Park (stakes) on first outing for new trainer four weeks ago; a winner over this C&D; facing a tougher assignment than last time, unlikely to trouble the principals.

runners.name: Coppola
runners.comment: More on his plate this time but has to be taken seriously.
runners.spotlight: Goes for a hat-trick today and has managed ten wins from 28 career runs; got the job done in a stakes by three-quarters of a length at Gulfstream Park, showing early speed to lead from a wide draw in January; can figure despite moving up in class.

runners.name: Think Big
runners.comment: Concern he might not be fully tuned up so may be vulnerable.
runners.spotlight: Got the job done by 2Â½l at Fair Grounds two months ago in an allowance optional claimer; on target three times in his last six outings; not hard to turn elsewhere as has not been seen doing much trackwork recently.

8:30.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Handicap

runners.name: Philanthropist
runners.comment: Improved with each 2yo run, winning at Newcastle in September; more to come; contender
runners.spotlight: Improved with each of his three runs as a 2yo, getting off the mark in comfortable fashion at Newcastle in September (7f, AW debut); he will need to progress again to defy this opening mark but that would seem likely.

runners.name: Kirkdale
runners.comment: Made all to win Catterick novice in October last time (7f, soft); gelded since; contender
runners.spotlight: Three turf runs over 7f last autumn, improving to win a Catterick novice when last seen in October (soft ground); well drawn for a prominent racer; should continue to progress; gelded since last run.

runners.name: Prince Of India
runners.comment: Promise at two and won readily at Wolverhampton on last month's return; solid claims
runners.spotlight: Ran to a fair level in two of his three 2yo runs; tongue tied for his seasonal return in novice at Wolverhampton three weeks ago and ran out a comfortable winner; handicap mark raised 1lb but Rossa Ryan retains the ride and there could be more in the locker.

runners.name: Nahash
runners.comment: Absent since finishing down the field in York sales race in October; promise on AW before
runners.spotlight: Promise on AW on first two starts, making all at Wolverhampton last September; down the field in a York sales race (7f, soft) when last seen in October; capable of better this year but such progress is required.

runners.name: Stenmark
runners.comment: Matched 2yo form when 4th in a C&D maiden three weeks ago; hooded for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Matched the pick of his 2yo form when a close fourth of eight in a C&D maiden three weeks ago; hooded for this handicap debut; improvement needed but that's not out of the question.

runners.name: Stapleford Park
runners.comment: Improved for step up to 7f at Chester when last seen in September; gelded since; chance
runners.spotlight: Improved for the step up to 7f when overcoming a wide stall to win a Chester nursery last September; gelded during his absence; up 4lb but unexposed at the trip; AW debut.

runners.name: Captain Harry
runners.comment: Promise on first two starts before a stiff task when last seen; bred to take well to AW
runners.spotlight: Stiff task in an Irish sales race when last seen in September but his two runs in maidens had offered some promise; gelded since last seen; improvement required now handicapping but his pedigree offers hope of better now switched to AW.

runners.name: Platinum Crystal
runners.comment: Improved for drop to 6f when beating progressive rival at Newcastle last month; contender
runners.spotlight: Improved with each of her 2yo runs and took a step forward dropped to 6f when narrowly getting the better of a progressive opponent at Newcastle 19 days ago; 3lb rise not excessive but she has to prove she can be as effective back up in distance.

runners.name: Dandy Magic
runners.comment: 6f Tapeta win in November; solid runs in defeat since but the extra furlong needs to help
runners.spotlight: Ready win in a 6f nursery at Newcastle in November; similar form in defeat twice since and she needs improvement for the step back up to 7f if she is to come out on top.

runners.name: Juba
runners.comment: His one standout effort came on soft going; the step up in trip needs to spark a revival
runners.spotlight: Ran well at Newbury on his second 2yo run (6f, soft); should be sharper for recent return to action at Chelmsford (6f) but hopes rest on the step up to 7f and switch to handicaps sparking something extra.

5:27.race_name: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Moon Over The Sea
runners.comment: Scored at Wolverhampton eight days ago over 1m6f and shoulders 5lb penalty here.
runners.spotlight: Does most of his winning on AW at Wolverhampton (five wins there) but is also effective here (runner-up twice over C&D this year); scored at Wolverhampton eight days ago up in trip (1m6f) and shoulders 5lb penalty here; in good form but vulnerable to improvers.

quotes.race: Â£30 In Free Bets With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: There was no real pace on paper beforehand. I wasn't going quick where I was but if I'd been going any quicker I'd have taken Moon Over The Sea out of his comfort zone. He's seen the trip out well - Jason Watson, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Educate
runners.comment: Has tumbled in the weights since joining this yard but yet to make the frame.
runners.spotlight: Has tumbled in the weights since joining this yard but yet to make the frame in eight starts and remains one to leave alone until he shows more.

runners.name: Kalikapour
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Won over C&D for Roger Fell off this mark in December and should run well.
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D for Roger Fell off this mark in December with Gianluca Sanna aboard; not beaten far on second start for new yard when seventh of 19 at Doncaster (1m2f, good) ten days ago and should run well.

runners.name: Hawa Jumeirah
runners.comment: Got off the mark at Wolverhampton AW in January off 3lb lower mark; not out of this.
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at Wolverhampton (1m4f, AW) in January off 3lb lower mark; a beaten favourite back there twice subsequently but was only beaten 3l when sixth of 11 there (9.5f) last month when a stronger pace would have suited better; lightly raced and not out of this on course debut.

runners.name: Rubellite
runners.owner: Tony Culhane Racing & The Good Racing Co
runners.comment: In red-hot form on AW this year with four wins including one over C&D in January.
runners.spotlight: In red-hot form on AW this year with four wins including one over C&D in January; tapped for toe when third of seven at Newcastle (1m2f) two weeks ago and looks sure to be thereabouts back at her best distance.

runners.name: Tazaman
runners.comment: Last win was in June 2022 but was respectable second here when last seen in September.
runners.spotlight: Hasn't been seen much since his last win in June 2022 but was respectable second here (1m6f) when last seen in September; usually races over further and may find this too sharp.

runners.name: Ana Emaraaty
runners.comment: All four wins have been at Newcastle AW, his latest a career best two weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: All four wins have been at Newcastle AW, his latest a career best (1m2f) two weeks ago; finished last on his two previous visits here and stepping back up in trip is not sure to suit.

quotes.race: Gamble Responsibly At BetUK Classified Stakes (Div II)
quotes.quote: I just said to James [Callow] the owner there, that I actually thought Jimmy Sullivan had got away on us; he gave his a peach out in front, but Ana Emaraaty did all his best work in the last furlong. He relaxed real good for me early on, so it was perfect. The further he went, the better he went, and I wouldn't be surprised if he got a bit further as well - Paul Mulrennan, jockey speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He'll be one for the all-weather. He's a bit of a lad and we've given him the summer off, and I expect he'll do well on the all-weather. Last year he didn't take too many races and I was guilty of running him too often. But I'm looking forward to training him during the winter and there are big bonuses to be won with horses like him. 02-10-24

runners.name: Lednikov
runners.comment: All four wins on AW have been here, the latest over C&D last month off 4lb lower mark.
runners.spotlight: All four wins on AW have been here, the latest over C&D last month off 4lb lower mark; looks sure to go close once again.

quotes.race: BetUK's Acca Club Â£5 Free Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a furlong shorter today and Lednikov needed every stride, but Joey gave him a great ride. The horse is very genuine, he gives his best all the time, and he's versatile - Ivan Furtado, trainer.

runners.name: This Time Maybe
runners.comment: Won on 17th start at Wolverhampton seven days ago but held by Rubellite on previous run.
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark on 17th start at Wolverhampton AW (1m4f) seven days ago but held by Rubellite on previous run there; has 5lb penalty and looks unlikely to follow up.

runners.name: Forglen
runners.comment: Yet to be placed from five starts but was encouraging fourth of ten over C&D last month.
runners.spotlight: Yet to be placed from five starts but was encouraging fourth of ten over C&D last month following wind surgery; may have more to give.

runners.name: Lumberjack
runners.comment: 15-race maiden and has been below par on his last two starts; others preferred.
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden and has been below par on his last two starts; dropping back in trip not sure to suit and first-time visor replaces cheekpieces; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He is a half-brother to Sugauli as well as four other winners. His work has been pleasing as he goes nicely and I would anticipate him starting out some time in August. Everything he has done at home has pleased me. 10-06-21

7:00.race_name: Win Â£1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Delicacy
runners.comment: Raced freely and failed to see out 1m in two runs for new yard; chance down in trip/grade
runners.spotlight: Won a small-field 1m event on her final start for Richard Hannon but that trip has looked to stretch her in two starts for her new trainer; eased in class and drops to 7f today; chance if she settles better.

quotes.race: AK Bets Best Price Premier League Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Sean gave Delicacy a really sympathetic ride and said she was always in his hands and going well. She's in the sales and I suppose she'll still go as there isn't a race for her before then - Rolf Johnson, owners' representative.

runners.name: Biplane
runners.comment: Traffic issues the last twice; handicapped to go well back at 7f; respected
runners.spotlight: Easy win in a 6f handicap here at Newcastle in February before only just missing out at over 6f here two days later; she has encountered traffic issues twice since and is handicapped to go well back up to 7f.

runners.name: Blufferonthebus
runners.comment: Well held at 40-1 in two 7f Tapeta handicaps this year; others have less to prove
runners.spotlight: Well held at big prices in two 7f Tapeta handicaps this year; edging down the weights but others bring more compelling claims.

runners.name: Larchill Lass
runners.comment: 5f turf win for K Burke last May; feasible mark starting out for this yard; new tongue-tie
runners.spotlight: 5f turf win for Karl Burke last May; runner-up in a 6f nursery at Pontefract in October before not getting home over 1m there (soft ground) when last seen; tongue-tie fitted on stable debut (still owned by Nick Bradley Racing); Hector Crouch a notable jockey booking.

runners.name: Art Patron
runners.comment: Improved with each run as a 2yo; should have more to offer in handicaps this year
runners.spotlight: Improved with each of her three 2yo runs, front-running third of seven at Salisbury in September (7f, good to soft); bred to do better and she's an interesting handicap debutante.

runners.name: Zizi
runners.comment: Won an 8.6f maiden at Wolverhampton when last seen; more required handicapping back at 7f
runners.spotlight: Off the mark upped to 8.6f at Wolverhampton when last seen in September; not sure that was a great race and she will need to progress again if she is to defy her opening mark back down at 7f.

runners.name: Eliza Bennet
runners.comment: Good second at Wolverhampton (7f) when last seen; type to do better in handicaps this year
runners.spotlight: Modest form in her first two starts but there was a marked step forward when second of nine at Wolverhampton on her third and final 2yo run (7f); bred to do better still and she's more appealing than many, back from six months off.

runners.name: Calaxy
runners.comment: C&D win on 3rd 2yo start; work to do with Art Patron on earlier turf form
runners.spotlight: 200-1 when fifth at Salisbury in September (behind Art Patron); took a step forward switched to AW when winning a C&D fillies' maiden one month later (AW debut ); could have more to come.

runners.name: Veraison
runners.comment: 7f AW win last summer; off since down the field in 1m nursery here in October; new hood
runners.spotlight: Found plenty when winning a 7f fillies' maiden at Wolverhampton last summer; only fifth of seven on her nursery debut here (1m) when last seen in October; down 3lb and now goes in a hood for the first time.

runners.name: Party Bear
runners.comment: Improved for AW and/or handicapping this year; 4lb rise for Wolverhampton win last time
runners.spotlight: Hint of ability in three turf runs last summer but she has fared better since switched to AW handicaps, finishing second at Wolverhampton in January (6f) before winning over 7f at Wolverhampton 17 days ago; 4lb rise shouldn't prevent another big run.

runners.name: Paint The Town Red
runners.comment: Promise in early-season 2yo events last spring; absent 321 days; bred to stay 7f
runners.spotlight: Three runs in early-season 2yo events last spring, showing her best form when second at Wolverhampton (5f) last May; bred to stay this far but not easily recommended back from 321 days off.

runners.name: Cushty
runners.owner: Formulated Polymer Products, Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Newcastle third last September is head and shoulders above her other runs; plenty to prove
