runners.spotlight: Big step forward when third of eight at Newcastle (7f) last September; she has failed to build on it in two runs since and does not look a solid option returned to handicap company.

7:30.race_name: BetMGM: It's Showtime Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: American Treasure
runners.comment: Debut third (of four) wasn't without hope but improvement will be needed to take this
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise when third of four in a 6f novice at Kempton on debut six weeks ago; she will need to raise her game to come out on top here though.

runners.name: Nazuki
runners.comment: Two C&D runs last autumn, finishing second before an easy win; major player under penalty
runners.spotlight: Confirmed the promise of October's debut effort here when readily seeing off her nine rivals in another C&D novice in November; leading form claims despite the penalty; Rossa Ryan was on board for the win but rides American Treasure this time.

runners.name: Coeur Jaune
runners.comment: Debut 3rd is strong form but two subsequent efforts leave her with plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Beaten just over 2l by the subsequent Queen Mary winner Leovanni on Nottingham debut last summer and soft ground was a valid excuse for her short-priced defeat at Ripon two weeks later; tailed off over 5f here in February when back from an eight-month break and now has something to prove.

runners.name: Desert Beauty
runners.comment: 50-1, green and well beaten on her recent Chelmsford debut; big step forward needed
runners.spotlight: 50-1, slowly away and green on her recent Chelmsford debut (6f); owner appears to have more pressing claims with American Treasure.

runners.name: Insuspense
runners.comment: 80-1 and too green to do herself justice when well beaten at Kempton last October (6f)
runners.spotlight: Too green to do herself justice when well beaten at 80-1 for her debut last October (6f, Polytrack); likely one for the longer term.

runners.name: Piddies Pearl
runners.comment: Just minor appeal on paper and likely best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: Newcomer by Rajasinghe out of a 6f winner whose only previous foal has shown little in two runs; not easily recommended.

runners.name: Straight Back Up
runners.comment: Two Thirsk runs last summer, failing to build on promising debut (7f) one month later (6f)
runners.spotlight: Shaped nicely over 7f on her Thirsk debut last July; not so good at the same track (6f) one month later and absent since; each-way shout if returning to the debut form on her first AW run.

runners.name: Sychell
runners.comment: Didn't live up to market billing on debut last October (6f, heavy); can leave that behind
runners.spotlight: 5-1 second favourite for a 6f fillies' novice at Windsor last October but she never featured in a race run on heavy ground; bred to do much better and it will be interesting to see if her supporters return.

runners.name: Vamp
runners.comment: Two promising AW runs 292 days apart; return to 6f in her favour; still capable of better
runners.spotlight: Debut effort last June (6f, Polytrack) was encouraging and she returned from 292 days off to finish a closing third at Wolverhampton a fortnight ago (5f); going back over 6f is in her favour and she's high on the list.

stable_tour.quote: I like this filly but she won't be out again for a while. 18-09-24

6:30.race_name: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Bern Rossetti
runners.comment: Showed promise over 7f and 5f on turf last summer; bred to act on AW; handicaps on horizon
runners.spotlight: Showed promise as 2yo over 7f at Redcar and in a competitive 5f Beverley maiden; has AW winners in his immediate pedigree but his latest run suggests this 5f may be on the sharp side; handicaps on the horizon.

runners.name: Mc Moan
runners.comment: Promising 6f debut at Wolverhampton; a likely improver for in-form yard
runners.spotlight: Well-connected dam bred a Tapeta winner; easy to back but he ran quite promisingly on 6f debut at Wolverhampton considering he raced wide and was hampered early in straight; has potential at 5f for in-form yard.

runners.name: Memphisatmidnight
runners.comment: Â£52,000 yearling; dam won both AW starts; likely to need the run and a longer trip
runners.spotlight: Â£52,000 yearling; fourth foal; Dandy Man half-brother to winners On The Pulse (6f/7f 2yo; RPR 74) and Mad Alwasil (KSA 7f dirt); dam won both AW starts, at 7f/9.4f (73); likely to need the run and a  longer trip.

runners.name: Mwafaq
runners.owner: Mohammed Bin Hamad Khalifa Al Attiyah
runners.comment: Late foal; good family with AW connections; creditable show over 6f at York in October
runners.spotlight: Good family with useful AW connections; late foal who ran over 6f on turf as 2yo, running well for a long way in a useful York novice in October; gelded since; can do better as a 3yo.

runners.name: Nordic Games
runners.comment: Bred for much longer trips than 5f; dropped right out on latest 6f run; tongue-tie added
runners.spotlight: Bred for much longer trips than 5f and although he wasn't disgraced on 6f debut at Wolverhampton in March he was beaten a long way out there last week (unseated before start); best watched; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Westgate Warrior
runners.comment: 66-1, down the field in both starts for J Macey as 2yo; ordinary handicaps more suitable
runners.spotlight: 66-1 for both turf starts as 2yo for Jessica Macey when right down the field; ordinary handicaps more suitable after this.

runners.name: A Day In Bloom
runners.comment: 28-1 for 5f debut at Chelmsford last Thursday and was beaten a long way after slow start
runners.spotlight: 28-1 for 5f debut at Chelmsford last Thursday and was beaten a long way after starting slowly; best watched for now.

runners.name: Alondra
runners.comment: Had the pace for 5f when an encouraging 4th on reappearance; this looks easier
runners.spotlight: All 2yo races at about 6f, failing to go on from a promising debut at Newmarket; an inability to settle was more of a problem than a lack of speed when dropped to 5f at Wolverhampton 15 days ago but she kept on well in the straight and this is likely to take less winning.

runners.name: Queensmaite
runners.comment: Dam bred multiple AW winning sprinters for this yard; likely this one will need the run
runners.spotlight: By Massaat; two of dam's siblings were AW winners and she's bred two multiple winning sprinters on sand (Hiya Maite and Jeans Maite) for this yard; it seems likely this one will come on for a run or two, though.

runners.name: Radio Star
runners.comment: Speedy and free-going at 5f, including on Polytrack; should go well on Tapeta debut
runners.spotlight: Speedy and free-going at 5f, most significantly on Lingfield Polytrack and when only just denied in a Nottingham novice (soft) on final 2yo start; could settle better now hooded; bred to act on Tapeta; should go well.

runners.name: Disclosure
runners.comment: Made a winning stable debut at Lingfield last week; big player despite the 5lb penalty
runners.spotlight: 0-11 for George Boughey but she dropped in the weights and made a winning start for James Owen when readily accounting for five rivals at Lingfield last week; that effort was backed up by the Topspeed figure and she's a key player despite the 5lb penalty.

runners.name: Billy Mcgarry
runners.comment: Banging at the door prior to his C&D win in a similar race 18 days ago; heavily involved
runners.spotlight: He had been banging at the door prior to winning a similar event over C&D 18 days ago, wearing down Mr Stanley in the straight; 2lb rise shouldn't prevent another big run.

runners.name: Just Rita
runners.comment: Exposed maiden who hasn't been at her best the last twice; change of headgear today
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden; second over 7f here in early January but well below that level twice since; change of headgear today; others appeal more.

runners.name: Jack Daniel
runners.comment: More promising signs after a wind op 11 days ago; dangerous mark and Rossa Ryan booked
runners.spotlight: Well treated on old form and there were more promising signs from him here 11 days ago, his first run after wind surgery; Rossa Ryan booked and he's one to consider.

runners.name: Angelica K
runners.comment: Supported at big odds for Kempton win in February; less good latest; unexposed at 1m
runners.spotlight: Returned from 144 days off to win a 1m handicap at Kempton in February in good style (backed at big odds); less good at Chelmsford last time but remains relatively unexposed at this trip.

runners.name: Heretic

prev_owners.owner: Highclere Tbred Racing, C Fahy & Partner

runners.comment: Two good efforts in defeat here in recent weeks; unexposed in cheekpieces; on the premises
runners.spotlight: Two good efforts in defeat here in recent weeks and should go well again; unexposed in cheekpieces.

runners.name: Mickey Mongoose
runners.comment: C&D win in February off 5lb lower; defeats off this mark since highlight his vulnerability
runners.spotlight: Successful over C&D in February off a 5lb lower mark; three creditable efforts have followed but they highlight the fact he needs more to defy this mark.

runners.name: Copper Mountain
runners.comment: Asserted in final 100 yards when a snug winner at Newcastle (7f) latest; this is tougher
runners.spotlight: Two-time C&D winner; off the mark for the year with a snug win in a 7f classified event at Newcastle 17 days ago, asserting in the final 100 yards; more on her plate back in a handicap but holds each-way claims.

quotes.race: Royal Pigeon Racing Association Handicap
quotes.quote: Joanna (Mason) said that Copper Mountain got stuck in the mud at Redcar. She also said that, like every horse, they've got to want to win and she does want to win. She might go for a mile-and-two race now, there's a race for her at Beverley in a couple of weeks - David Easterby, trainer.

runners.name: Royal Jet
runners.comment: Running himself into form for T Carroll; back up in trip today; warrants a market check
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three 7f runs since joining Tony Carroll; not beaten all that far on the latest occasion and 3lb lower today; missed an intended run at Southwell on Friday with a vet's certificate (temperature); returns to 1m and warrants a market check.

runners.name: Timebar
runners.comment: Stayed on late for close 5th at Wolverhampton four weeks ago (7f); extra furlong may help
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all 11 starts; kept on all the way to the finishing line when a 2l fifth of ten at Wolverhampton (7f) four weeks ago; now returns to a mile and he could have a bigger run in him.

runners.name: Beautiful Dawn
runners.comment: Placed twice in February but well short of that level over C&D 18 days ago
runners.spotlight: Placed twice in February, including over C&D, but she turned in a lacklustre display here 18 days ago; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Although Beautiful Dawn was coming back in trip, I thought we went a good and even pace and it was playing into my hands well. My horse stays very well and she's tough. She picked up nicely and I felt I put the race to bed but the boys were always breathing down my neck. We're sharing the spoils with Jamie but I'm delighted to get another win beside her name - Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey.

runners.name: Mr Stanley
runners.comment: Had quite a soft lead when 2nd over C&D last time; needs more to make it 30th time lucky
runners.spotlight: Took record to 0-29 when chasing home Billy McGarry over C&D last month; enjoyed a relatively soft lead that day and is likely vulnerable for win purposes again.

runners.name: Twistaline
runners.comment: Two C&D wins last January; up and down this winter though and others look safer
runners.spotlight: Two C&D wins last January; in and out this winter and there's a suspicion that a few others will have her measure again today.

runners.name: Barneys Bay
runners.breeder: Highclere Stud & Mr Ilyas Emir Karadag
runners.comment: Placed twice over 7f this year but inconsistent and opposable for win purposes
runners.spotlight: Two placed efforts this year, both over 7f, but inconsistent and remains opposable for win purposes.

6:00.race_name: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Handicap

runners.name: Eager Puccini
runners.comment: Late foal; down the field on all three starts; makes handicap debut but hard to fancy.
runners.spotlight: Late foal; down the field at triple-figure odds on all three starts; makes handicap debut but hard to fancy.

runners.name: Perfect Parole
runners.comment: Made her breakthrough at Wolverhampton in February but beaten twice since.
runners.spotlight: Made her breakthrough at Wolverhampton (8.5f) in February; flopped at Kempton 11 days later but respectable fourth of eight at Lingfield (1m2f; hung badly left) last month; record now stands at 1-11 and she looks weighted up to her best; cheekpieces (absent last time) back on.

runners.name: No Release
runners.breeder: Natton House Thoroughbreds & Mr G Bishop
runners.comment: 14-race maiden but has been runner-up four times; not out of this.
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden but runner-up four times; ran no sort of race when last of nine in first-time visor at Newcastle AW (1m) last month and reverts back to blinkers here; the penny will drop one of these days and he's now on a career-low mark; not out of this.

runners.name: Ballarat Bertie
runners.comment: Got off the mark at the eighth attempt, at Wolverhampton (9.5f) last month.
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark at eighth attempt, at Wolverhampton (9.5f, AW) last month when the step up in trip made the difference; dropping back to 1m is not certain to suit but he's on an upward curve and cannot be discounted.

runners.name: Magna
runners.comment: Eight-race maiden but has been runner-up on her last three starts over 1m/7f.
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden but has shown improvement and has been runner-up on her last three starts over 1m/7f; knocking on the door and must go close, at the least.

runners.name: Pacific Man
runners.comment: Has shown little on his three starts but gelded and makes handicap debut for good yard.
runners.spotlight: Has shown little on his three starts but has been gelded since his last run in September and makes handicap debut for excellent yard; one to watch for in the market.

runners.name: I Can Boogy
runners.comment: Six-race maiden but showed improvement when second of 12 at Newcastle last month.
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden but showed significant improvement when second of 12 at Newcastle (7f, AW) last month; steps up in trip and should go close.

runners.name: Mission In Malton
runners.comment: Beat only two horses in his three starts last summer; upped in trip on AW/handicap debut.
runners.spotlight: Has beaten only two horses in his three starts; gelded since his last run (July) and steps up in trip on AW/handicap debut; market watch advised.

runners.name: Big Gypsy King
runners.comment: Finished last on all three starts last year and steps up in trip on stable/handicap debut.
runners.spotlight: Finished last on all three starts last year for Darryll Holland; she steps up in trip on stable/handicap debut and first-time hood worn on last run is dispensed with; one to watch for in the betting.

runners.name: My Boy Harry
runners.comment: Well held last year and never dangerous when fifth of eight at Chelmsford 12 days ago.
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on all three starts last year and never dangerous on stable/handicap debut when fifth of eight at Chelmsford AW (6f) 12 days ago; steps up in trip and needs to show more.

runners.name: Clipsham Noble
runners.comment: Nine-race maiden and has shown low-level form in three starts this year.
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden and has shown low-level form in three starts this year; steps up in trip and the first-time visor worn last time is dispensed with; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Pretty Spirited
runners.owner: Dr M Voikhansky & Mrs S Voikhanskaya
runners.comment: Beat one home in three starts last year; makes handicap/AW debut.
runners.spotlight: Beat only one home in three starts last year; makes handicap/AW debut and big improvement required.

3:32.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap

runners.name: Dream Composer
runners.comment: Below par on final two runs last season but won over C&D previously; 2-5 here; considered
runners.spotlight: Below par on final two outings last season but before those he won in good style over C&D (disputed lead) to make it 2-5 here; can go well fresh and he's one to consider on his reappearance.

quotes.race: Aston Martin "Dash" Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: We bought Dream Composer very inexpensively from France three years ago - he'd run as a 2yo there - and he's won for us every year. He keeps stepping up, and obviously this is the icing on the cake, winning one like this. He's won some good races at Grade One tracks; we just felt he was handicapped quite well today, and the cut in the ground helps him. He's pretty good at going up and down dale, because he's won at Goodwood and places like that. We were going along as we found it; he's got an entry in the Wokingham and if a penalty gets him into it and there's cut in the ground, he likes Ascot and has run well there, so that's a possible. But we'll enjoy today and see where it takes us - James Evans, trainer.

quotes.race: Cavani Menswear Sartorial Sprint Handicap
quotes.quote: I think the ground was a bit too lively at Royal Ascot. Dream Composer has been travelling much better in his races so the five seems to suit well now. There is the five-furlong handicap on the first day of Glorious Goodwood which is a 0-105 and that was a thought, and obviously the Stewards' Cup would come into consideration as well - James Evans, trainer.

quotes.race: Peroni Nastro Azzurro Handicap
quotes.quote: Dream Composer has great form here and likes this ground, so everything was in our favour. The race went to plan and he keeps galloping. He probably likes 6f more than five, but the ground helped him - you might as well use his stamina over five - Mollie Phillips, rider.

runners.name: Venture Capital
runners.comment: Suited by the drop back to 5f last autumn and he could have more to offer this term
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who was suited by the drop back to 5f when winning at Doncaster (5f, good) last September and ran well in defeat the next twice (5f, soft); this unexposed 4yo could have more to offer this term.

quotes.race: JKR Industrial Cleaning Ltd Handicap
quotes.quote: Venture Capital showed a lot of speed last time at Thirsk and immediately after the race my old man felt that sprinting could be his gig and he's shown that there. It was only his first try over six furlongs so I'd like to think there's a lot more to come from him. There's some nice sprints in the summer and he's shown he handles the ground there. We'll see what the handicapper does but he could progress now at that trip. The time was good there and in these big sprint handicaps you need a horse that stays the trip well so that's a big positive. We'll see what comes up but I'm sure by the end of the year there will be bigger and better things on the horizon - Adam Ryan, trainer's son and assistant.

stable_tour.quote: He's very genuine and we've been very lucky with the sire's progeny. He's a homebred and the owner's first winner and I can see them having some good fun with him on turf. He'll get a mile no problem and we'll look for a nice handicap and work from there. 04-04-24

runners.name: Alzahir

prev_owners.owner: Al Wasmiyah Stud, G Bailey, N Wrigley

runners.comment: Won at Doncaster recently and remains well treated under a penalty, but that was over 7f
runners.spotlight: Returned from wind surgery to win in a big field at Doncaster (7f, good) nine days ago; under a 5lb penalty he remains well treated on his old form and he ran fairly well over 6f at Newcastle (AW) in January, but he's never raced over this trip so has a question to answer today.

stable_tour.quote: A half-brother to Suedois who had a couple of runs for us last year and I think he could do well. He wants fast ground over seven furlongs or an easy mile. He's had a nice break and has come back working well. 19-04-24

He was purchased at the horses in training sale for 20,000gns. He runs on December 7 at Wolverhampton in a 0-85 and with luck in running he should go close. He was unlucky last time and probably would have been a lot closer had he got out, but he's dropping in grade at Wolverhampton and I think he should win. 05-12-24

runners.name: Manila Scouse
runners.comment: Disappointing end to last season but has a good reappearance record; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Disappointing on final three runs last term but won twice during that campaign (6f/5f, good/good to soft) and he's run well to finish second on his reappearances in each of the last two seasons; not ruled out.

quotes.race: tote On The Go At tote.co.uk Racing League 18 Handicap (Trainers Reg' To Racing League)
quotes.quote: Manila Scouse probably just likes the rain and the uphill finish, because he stays six [furlongs] so he travels really strong as well and gets through the line strong - David Allan, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Manila Scouse ran a blinder last week and the drop back to five really suited him. He stays it really well, especially in that ground. He's very game and stuck on well in the last furlong - Oliver Stammers, jockey.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)
quotes.quote: Manila Scouse loved this ground and the tongue-tie helped as well - Paul Mulrennan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He had time off as a three-year-old, we couldn't train him, but he came back really well last season. He wants five furlongs with some cut. He was entered at Newmarket, but the ground was advertised as fast so I didn't declare him, although it actually would have been all right. 23-04-24

runners.name: Nazron
runners.comment: Won last August but well beaten the last twice; returns from a break and wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Won at Windsor (5f, good to firm) last August for Roger Varian but well beaten towards the end of last year on first two runs for this yard and hopes are pinned on the subsequent wind surgery prompting a revival.

quotes.race: Boost Your Acca At BetMGM Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Job done I think for Nazron. He's ran consistent all year. He's a nice horse and it was nice to get his head in front, so hopefully that will give him a bit of confidence going forward - David Egan, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Ventura Express
runners.comment: Four-time C&D winner who reappeared with close 2nd at Newcastle last month; lots to like
runners.spotlight: Four-time C&D winner who reappeared with close second at Newcastle (5f, AW) last month; has the rail draw and there's lots to like.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Now Handicap
quotes.quote: Ventura Express jumped a little bit slow but he soon travelled well through the race and he picked up and won nicely. I thought he would run well but I didn't quite expect that. He's been gelded which makes a massive difference because I don't think there's much else different than what Richard Fahey does, they're a lot better than us! - Paul Midgley, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's been fantastic for us and absolutely adores Pontefract. The course is everything he needs as it's a stiff 5f and he's always at his best there. He's really solid and seldom runs a bad race because he's so honest and genuine, and he probably overachieves a little bit. Last time at Thirsk I don't think they went that hard early, whikind of played against him. But he'll probably go to Beverley or Pontefract again next time. Handicap wise, he'd be at the top of where he needs to be but last season we had to step him up a grade and he still ran well. He wears his heart on his sleeve. 28-06-24

runners.name: Vince Lamour
runners.comment: Inconsistent last season but won three times and he's not discounted on return to action
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent last season but won three times and, while those came on heavy/soft ground, he also ran some big races on good/good to soft going; not discounted on his return to action.

runners.name: Fahrenheit Seven
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo; three wins last year and reappeared with good third on AW; drawn well
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who won three times last year (5f/6f, including on good/good to soft) and reappeared with good third at Newcastle last month (5f, AW; Ventura Express second); could build on that and is drawn well.

runners.name: Intervention
runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd
runners.comment: Poor turf strike-rate and recent AW win came over 7f, but he's not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his 30 turf starts and a wide draw could be a negative, while his recent AW win came over 7f; however, he ran well in a 5f handicap on grass last July and is not ruled out.

quotes.race: Win Â£2,000,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a fantastic win again and Intervention is just an amazing horse. That's eleven wins since we bought him, his last four on the bounce. He's going on seven, in the form of his life and is better than ever. It secures at least sharing the top prize for the all-weather horse of the month at the Arc (Arena Racing Company) tracks in December because that's three wins from his last three runs. We're thrilled with him, he came to us as a longstanding maiden and Mick's just worked wonders with him. He's a bit of a hero of ours, he's won more races for us than any other horse and he's a firm favourite - Chris Dixon, syndicate boss.

stable_tour.quote: Our winningmost horse with 11 victories. He had quite a few goes before we bought him and he's won all those races for us and well over Â£100,000 in prize-money. He's just a legend. He runs his race nearly every time and always seems to be in the money. He's come down to a good mark again for the all-weather season and he's ready to win again soon. He's having a break now and usually thrives through the winter. 26-09-24

runners.name: Brooklyn Nine Nine
runners.comment: Mixed form since December AW win; needs something extra with blinkers replacing ch'pieces
runners.spotlight: Won off this mark at Southwell (5f, AW) in December and also effective on turf (albeit 0-10 on grass); however, his form has been mixed since that win; needs something extra with blinkers replacing cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Top Odds Every Day With BetUK Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think Brooklyn Nine Nine just got a bit tired the last half furlong but he got the job done. I started on the outside rail but he just drifted a bit left and I think he got a bit lonely. His two runs last year were very good and I think he needed that today so he's going to come on a bit for it - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Wen Moon
runners.comment: 0-11 last year but often ran well, including when third in this race; could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: 0-11 last year but was placed on all three visits here (heavy-good; including in this race on reappearance); could be in the mix on his return.

runners.name: Lesleys Boy
runners.comment: Two wins last summer and close third in October when last seen; gelded since; respected
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-3 when winning on nursery debut at Ripon (6f, good) last August and returned to form with very close third at Newcastle (7f, AW) in October; gelded since and he's respected on his return to action.

quotes.race: Paula Budge Surprise Birthday Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Lesley's Boy did well to win because he didn't really handle the track. I was off the bridle for most of the way, it was probably his ability that got him through today. It's a hard track, there are plenty of undulations but it worked out okay for me. He's improving with racing and I hope he keeps going the right way - Oisin Orr, jockey.

runners.name: Dark Cloud Rising
runners.comment: Promise during light 2yo campaign and he retains potential for his good yard
runners.spotlight: Won at Thirsk (6f, good) last August on second start and creditable third in Haydock novice (6f, good to soft) next time; down the field in soft-ground Listed race when last seen (gelded in interim) but he retains potential for his good yard now making his handicap debut.

runners.name: Cayman Tai
runners.owner: Ian Wight, Tony Lyons And Ptnr

prev_owners.owner: Ian Wight, Mrs Teresa Lyons And Ptnr

runners.comment: Fine second of 16 in nursery at Glorious Goodwood last August; represents in-form yard
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on first three starts before winning Ffos Las novice (5f, good to soft) last June, after which he was a fine second of 16 in a nursery at Glorious Goodwood (6f, good to firm); failed to back that up when mid-division at York but remains capable of better and his yard is in good form.

runners.name: Peter The Wolf
runners.comment: Has shown promise but improvement is needed on his handicap and seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) last September on his third start but didn't kick on from that and improvement is necessary if he's to make a winning handicap and seasonal debut.

runners.name: Fan Mail
runners.comment: Close 4th on last month's handicap debut on AW; player if transferring form back to turf
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the fifth attempt in Newcastle maiden (6f, AW) in February and close fourth of 11 on subsequent handicap debut at Southwell (6f, AW), where not enjoying a clear run; well beaten on his two turf starts last summer but he's a player if transferring his AW improvement back to grass.

runners.name: Middleton View
runners.comment: Second on AW in February; pedigree provides optimism he'll be better than his opening mark
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on turf last May/June on first two starts but gelded subsequently and returned with close second of six at Kempton (6f, AW) in February; pedigree provides optimism he'll be better than his opening mark.

runners.name: Scatter Penny
runners.comment: Didn't really threaten in nurseries but won over C&D previously and is not discounted
runners.spotlight: Didn't really threaten in her three nurseries last August-November but she made it 2-2 when winning by 4l over C&D (good) last July and perhaps a break and the return to this course will be the catalyst for a good run.

runners.name: Invitorio
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Xviii & Ofo Partners
runners.comment: Won at Redcar last October on third start; this handicap newcomer has a useful pedigree
runners.spotlight: Promising third at Ayr (6f, good) last October on second start and won at Redcar (6f, soft) later that month; in good hands and his useful pedigree suggests he has potential off his handicap debut mark; on the shortlist.

runners.name: I Need Your Love
runners.comment: Won at Redcar last September on second nursery start; third the next twice; a possible
runners.spotlight: Won in a first-time visor (retained since) at Redcar (6f, good) last September on his second nursery start and finished third the next twice (5f/6f, heavy/soft); might not be far away on this reappearance.

runners.name: Justus

prev_owners.owner: LNJ Foxwoods, Michael Tabor & Mrs John Magnier

runners.comment: Tailed off over C&D last October and absent since, but he won this last year
runners.spotlight: Tailed off over C&D (soft) last October and absent since; however, he won this last year (heavy) and followed up at Ripon (soft), and he's probably fine on good/good to soft ground; not ruled out on reappearance.

quotes.race: Jamaican Flight Handicap (Round 1 Of The Pontefract Stayers' Championship 2024)
quotes.quote: Staying won the day and this ground is the key to him. Justus did well over hurdles and he stayed on well after getting outpaced here -  Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.name: Glory And Honour
runners.comment: Ran well over fences two starts ago and he won over C&D last October; could have big say
runners.spotlight: Mixed form over fences this year but was a good second in that sphere two starts ago (2m, good); won over C&D (soft) last October on penultimate Flat run and he's capable of having a big say if he's on a going day.

quotes.race: Living North Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Glory And Honour is a lovely horse and a joy to ride. He needs a really good gallop as he's such a strong traveller and doesn't find as much as you think he would. Today was an ideal scenario and it played into his hands. It was a nice opportunity to get his head back in front - Jonathan England, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Glory And Honour would appreciate the good ground. He was 3lb better off with the favourite so I couldn't see why he started the price he did - Sam England, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's arguably the best value-for-money horse we've bought. He cost Â£13,000 and since we purchased him last August he's never been out of the first three and has won Â£55,000 in prize-money. He's won twice for us, including the big Â£40k handicap chase at Doncaster in December. He's still running well and he'll go to Cartmel on June 30 for a big Â£40,000 chase - I think he'll run a big race. 14-06-24

runners.name: Golden Flame

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: On a reduced mark and has shown some spark this year, but his losing run continues
runners.spotlight: His mark continues to fall and he's shown some spark this year, finishing second at Newcastle (2m, AW) and a fair fourth of six at Kempton (2m, AW) last time; however, this regressive 7yo is without a win since September 2021 and isn't one to rely upon heavily.

quotes.race: "My Odds Boost" On Betfair Handicap
quotes.quote: It's pretty fast out there. The first two winners made all, it's suiting the front runners and Joe Fanning is the master of it - though, to be fair to Golden Flame, he looked as though he was the last off the bridle there - Jock Bennett, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Royal Deeside
runners.comment: Hasn't shone in various disciplines of late and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Third over hurdles/fences earlier in the season but well beaten on the Flat, over fences and over hurdles on his three starts for this yard, and remains a maiden after 21 races; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: He was placed nearly every run over hurdles last season, he's strengthened over the summer and, although I was rather disappointed with him at Plumpton two runs ago he did run much better at Warwick on Tuesday. His trip is 2m, to start with at least. 07-11-24

runners.name: Pigeon House
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L

prev_owners.owner: J P O'Flaherty & M E Phelan & Mrs J Harrington & R Galway

runners.comment: Useful hurdler who was a good second back on the Flat last week and is a key player
runners.spotlight: He's finished second a lot more often than he's won but this useful hurdler has potential off his Flat mark and was a good second when back in this code at Musselburgh (2m, good) last Wednesday; key player.

quotes.race: Specialist Group Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Pigeon House is entered on the Flat at Gowran next week and he will probably mix it. He had been threatening to do that all Winter and he liked that better ground - Jessica Harrington, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He was purchased in the Tattersalls online sale by the owners from Jessica Harrington's yard. He's being lined up to run on New Year's Day in the Hogmaneigh Hurdle at Musselburgh. He's rated in the 130s and he might be a bit better going right-handed. We thought that was a nice race to start him off and it would be a lovely way to start the year if he wins. 05-12-24

runners.name: Diamand De Vindecy

prev_owners.owner: Nicolas Longere & Ecurie Haras Des Beaux

runners.comment: Disappointing end to last year but below his last winning mark and is back in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Won at Haydock (2m, good) last June; unable to get competitive on the Flat and over hurdles subsequently last year but the reapplied cheekpieces may help and he's not written off, now 4lb lower than for last win.

runners.name: Bamboo Bay
runners.comment: Won at Redcar last September but faces tough task from 11lb out of the handicap
runners.spotlight: Won at Redcar (1m6f, good to firm) last September but this inconsistent 7yo faces a tough task today from 11lb out of the handicap.

quotes.race: Edinburgh Gin Classic London Dry Handicap
quotes.quote: Bamboo Bay's draw was a help and the gaps opened and he lengthened from the three-pole. You could step him up in trip and he's probably handicapped well enough - Kevin Stott, jockey

stable_tour.quote: He ran well last week at Beverley when he came second at 25-1 behind Pons Aelius. It was his third race for us and we stepped him up to 2m - his previous two starts came over 1m4f. He's a low-rated horse - he ran off 46 last time - but I was really pleased with him at Beverley and I think he'll now go to Ripon in a couple of weeks. He's at the right end of the handicap to start doing something. 22-08-24

runners.name: Detroit Lion
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo who was second at Southwell (AW) last month and could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who returned to form when staying on for second at Southwell (1m3f, AW) last month; unproven on turf but he can be in the mix if the return to grass isn't an issue.

runners.name: Value Added

prev_owners.owner: HM The Queen & The Late Sir Chips Keswick
HM The King & HM The Queen

runners.comment: Well beaten on AW on both runs for this yard and has plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Won AW novice in July 2023 and third in two novice hurdles last summer, but she's been well beaten on AW on her first two runs for this yard; wears a first-time tongue-tie; plenty to prove.

quotes.race: Follow @AtTheRaces On Twitter Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: This was an opportunity we couldn't resist as we've got 20,000GBP for it being a Great British Bonus race. I'd love to aim Value Added at a fillies' handicap at Goodwood over a mile and a quarter as the race looks like it'll suit her - Richard Hughes, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She had some respectable form on the Flat for Richard Hughes - she was rated in the 80s - and appears an ideal type for juvenile hurdling. 15-11-23

This is the second of the two horses I train for the King and Queen and she is a lovely filly. On her sole run last year she was second at Newbury, only beaten a neck after which we put her away for the winter. She wintered nicely but I was in no hurry to get her out as she had a few issues in the spring so we gave her all the time she needed. She was meant to return at Windsor but broke out of the gate, which was very frustrating. Her comeback run was at Newbury where she ran well enough to be fifth of 13. She has come out of the race well and is likely to have her first run on the all-weather next at Wolverhampton over 1m1f. 29-06-23

runners.name: Ribble River
runners.comment: Won his final two starts last season and this unexposed 4yo could continue to improve
runners.spotlight: Progressive as he went up in trip in handicaps last year, winning at Carlisle (1m3f, good) in August and following up at Hamilton (1m4f, good to soft); this unexposed 4yo could continue to improve; respected on return.

runners.name: Billy No Mates
runners.comment: He's dropped down the weights but this 9yo was regressive last season
runners.spotlight: Has run well in defeat on all three visits here and he's dropped down the weights; however, this 9yo was regressive last season and a major turnaround is needed on today's reappearance.

quotes.race: William Hill Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap
quotes.quote: Billy No Mates was too high in the handicap last year. He hadn't run this season because he needs soft ground and it's been too firm for him. I was worried the trip would be too short but he outstayed them on the ground - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Every Race Live On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: The hood has definitely helped Billy No Mates. He's still strong early on but he settled into the race and picked up well - Clifford Lee, jockey.

runners.name: Trapper John
runners.owner: Andrew Mcgladdery And Park Lodge Stables
runners.comment: Down the field on all 4 starts, but may have needed handicap debut run; check the market
runners.spotlight: Down the field in his three novice races and same story on his handicap and seasonal debut at Southwell (1m3f, AW) three weeks ago; however, this lightly raced 4yo may have needed that run and a market check is advised.

runners.name: Vampire Slayer
runners.comment: Ran fairly well over hurdles in February; runner-up on last two Flat outings last spring
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who has produced mixed form over hurdles this year but he ran fairly well in that code in February (on good to soft); runner-up last spring on last two Flat outings (1m4f/1m3f, soft) and not discounted now back in this sphere.

runners.name: Sonning
runners.comment: Below par at end of last season but makes stable debut off a handy mark
runners.spotlight: Below par on the Flat and over fences last autumn on last few starts for Danny Brooke and sold for Â£4,000 in October; however, he's on a handy mark on last year's best Flat form and his new yard is among the winners; chance.

stable_tour.quote: I don't think he quite got a mile and a half on the Flat but mile - and - a - quarter horses should get two over hurdles and he's a little bit stronger as well now. He was second on his hurdling debut at Wincanton where he was a little novicey but will have learned plenty. 03-11-21

runners.name: Greenlightforgo
runners.comment: Soundly beaten on final two runs last year to make it 0-8; needs to raise his game
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo who was third at Redcar (1m6f, good to firm) last August and is now 4lb lower; however, he was soundly beaten the next twice (2m/1m6f) to make it 0-8, and has to raise his game on this reappearance.

stable_tour.quote: He's from a good Shadwell family and is going to be a nice staying type of horse one day. He's a big lad, 17 hands, and he needed the run at Ripon last week. 23-04-24

runners.name: Mr Zippi
runners.comment: Well treated on form as recent as December but three lesser runs have followed
runners.spotlight: Won two bumpers in 2023 and he returned from a break with a close fourth at Southwell (1m4f, AW) this winter; now 6lb lower but three lesser runs have followed and he needs to get back on track in first-time blinkers.

runners.name: Letmeseethecolts
runners.comment: Consistent filly who was runner-up in big field at Doncaster recently; solid contender
runners.spotlight: Bar one blip she's been running well since December, winning at Southwell (1m3f, AW) in January and finishing second of 18 at Doncaster (1m2f, good to soft) ten days ago; this step back up to 1m4f could be a plus and she's a solid contender.

runners.name: Livio Milo
runners.comment: 1-18 when trained by Dermot Weld; best watched on stable debut.
runners.spotlight: 1-18 and on the downgrade when trained by Dermot Weld; sold for 13,000gns in October last year; headgear removed and best watched on stable debut.

quotes.race: Caulfield Industrial Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: LIVIO MILO deserved it, he's very consistent and was second on his last three runs. He probably is better over a mile and that's why the plan was to push on and get first run. He battled hard and got a good ride. He is very versatile and that's his level - Dermot Weld, trainer.

runners.name: Yaajooz
runners.comment: Won weak selling handicap at Thirsk easily last July and not ruled out here.
runners.spotlight: Won weak selling handicap at Thirsk (1m, good to firm) easily last July on his final run for George Boughey; 1m2f may not have been ideal at Haydock on his stable debut the following month; not ruled out now back down in distance in first-time hood on seasonal debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's a new arrival this year and we ran him twice quickly at the end of last month, when he was second at Wolverhampton and then fourth when favourite at Southwell. He's still a maiden but I'm sure we can get him winning. 04-04-24

runners.name: Partisan Hero
runners.comment: Has run well on all five starts since joining this yard and scored at Kempton in February.
runners.spotlight: Has run well on all five starts since joining this yard and made all the running at Kempton AW (1m) in February last time; similar tactics look sure to be deployed back on turf and he should take some catching.

quotes.race: Societies Welcome At Gowran Park Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't use my whip much as I was fairly confident Partisan Hero was doing enough the whole way up the straight. His last furlong was probably his best so he will be able to go up in trip. There should be improvement in him - Jake Coen, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: A horse I bought out of Dermot Weld's, he had his first start for us at Windsor this month and just got done in second when he was probably unlucky. He was an expensive horse [72,000gns] for what he's rated [68], but I like him a lot and think he'll be a lovely horse. We got him in October and he's taken time to get right. It was quick enough at Windsor and he probably wants a bit of cut in the ground. I hope he could end up being a Saturday horse. 30-05-24

runners.name: Shaladar
runners.comment: Hasn't won since September 2022 but made the frame six times last year; place claims.
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won since September 2022 but made the frame six times last year and handicapper has given him a chance on his return to action; place claims at least.

stable_tour.quote: He thrived for a step up to a mile last year and ran really well in the second half of the season. He showed he's still going the same way when second on his comeback at Redcar and should continue to progress. We tried a mile and a quarter last year and it didn't seem to work - he travels strongly and seems suited by the better pace at a mile. 03-05-23

runners.name: Finn Russell
runners.comment: Not the most consistent and often refuses to settle but is a five-time winner.
runners.spotlight: Not the most consistent but in December he landed his fifth win; pulled away his chances (as so often) at Wolverhampton AW a month ago and much will depend on how he settles on his return to turf.

runners.name: Masqool
runners.comment: AW specialist (ten wins) making his first appearance on turf since last June.
runners.spotlight: AW specialist (ten wins) making his first appearance on turf since last June; has been competitive on AW during the winter, winning at Wolverhampton in December/January; sole success on turf came at Nottingham on soft in May 2023 and others may be more progressive.

quotes.race: MansionBet Proud Partners Of The AWC Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: James (Evans, trainer) said Masqool has come to him from Godolphin and every time he's done a bit of work he's improved. We thought he'd run well last time but we didn't think he'd go that close. And today he built on that. It felt like a long last furlong but he's still improving, it was only his fifth run and I think there will be a lot more fun on grass. He'll get a mile and a quarter - Dougie Costello, jockey.

runners.name: Milteye
runners.comment: Sole success came in May 2023 when trained by Jack Channon; trained in Ireland last year.
runners.spotlight: Sole success came in May 2023 when trained by Jack Channon; winless over hurdles and on the Flat when trained in Ireland last year and now makes debut for another new yard; probably best watched.

4:42.race_name: Celebrating The Life Of Cheryl Hibbert Handicap

runners.name: South Shore
runners.comment: Encouraging signs off reduced mark on AW recently; major player if backing that up
runners.spotlight: Has tumbled down the weights since joining this yard but took big step back in right direction when unlucky seventh of 11 at Newcastle recently (5f, AW; beaten just under 3l); another 3lb lower today and has won on turf; major player if backing up that latest performance.

runners.name: Torfrida
runners.breeder: M H Sly & Mrs P M Sly
runners.comment: Down the field on both runs in 2024 but good form of yard means she's worth a second look
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 5yo who finished down the field on both outings in 2024 (April/August); reappears with something to prove but she looked promising in 2023 and the good form of her stable means she's worth a second look.

runners.name: Wrestling Revenue
runners.comment: Yet to shine for current yard but he's on an attractive mark now back on turf
runners.spotlight: Yet to shine for current yard but he's been racing on AW and that may not be his thing; reverts to turf on an attractive mark and could bounce back and play a leading role, especially if there's market confidence.

runners.name: Herakles
runners.comment: Won off 2lb higher mark last June and could show the benefit of last month's comeback run
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent during the second half of last year but he won off a 2lb higher mark last June and didn't run badly on last month's reappearance at Newcastle (AW); could show the benefit of that outing today; not discounted.

stable_tour.quote: He's been great. He had a wind op and then won at Newcastle in January. He's pretty solid and pretty consistent. His Ripon win last time was a career-best and I'm hoping he'll progress as he gets stronger. I'd be amazed if he lasted all summer as he had a winter campaign, but he'll have a break at some stage and that could well be the making of him. He's a big, tall horse and hopefully he'll grow into something better than he is at the moment. 28-06-24

runners.name: Doddies Impact
runners.comment: Fair third at Newcastle last time and he's not ruled out now back on turf
runners.spotlight: Won in first-time cheekpieces (retained since) at Newcastle (5f, AW) in December; up and down since but ran okay when third at Newcastle (5f, AW) last time; won on turf on debut back in April 2023; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network EBF Brocklesby Stakes (A Novice Stakes) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: That went very nicely. Mr Brisland had Doddie's Impact in good shape coming in to it and he's done it nicely in the end. I'd been in in the week to have a little sit on him before he ran and I thought he'd go close. I think he might have had a tough opponent there today but he knuckled down well and got the job done. He wanted to win - Billy Loughnane, rider.

stable_tour.quote: People will remember him winning the Brocklesby and he's settled in well since joining us. A scopey sort who has kept strengthening since we've had him, he'll be entered in the Coventry as I'm keen to try him over six. 13-06-23

runners.name: Kings Crown
runners.comment: Two AW wins this year but below par the last twice and needs to bounce back
runners.spotlight: Won at Southwell (6f, AW) in January and at Newcastle (5f, AW) last month; however, he needs to bounce back from below-par runs at Newcastle the last twice and he's just 1-25 on turf.

stable_tour.quote: We got him earlier this season from Adrian Nicholls. He was highly tried at two and three and has now dropped to what is a good handicap mark. He started the season on 72 and is down to 62 now. When he puts it together I can't believe he won't be winning soon. He'd be my dark horse. 28-08-24

runners.name: Crocodile Power
runners.comment: Three wins at Catterick last August-October and can also be effective elsewhere; chance
runners.spotlight: Won three times at Catterick (6f, good/soft) last August-October; he can also be effective elsewhere and is not short of pace, so may cope with the drop back to 5f on his reappearance; chance if fully tuned up.

runners.name: One More Dream
runners.comment: Won at Wolverhampton in February but he's 9-38 on AW as opposed to just 1-16 on grass
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) in February and some fair efforts on AW since; he ran some okay races on turf last season but he's 9-38 on AW as opposed to just 1-16 on grass, despite having a lower mark in this sphere.

stable_tour.quote: He's a decent all-weather horse and has won at Newcastle and Southwell this month and been second twice. He may switch back to turf but dry ground is quite important to him. When he's right he tries very hard and he's the sort who's important to the yard because he can win two or three a year and if every horse did that you'd have an awful lot of winners. He's entered at Newcastle on Friday. 20-03-24

runners.name: Mrs Trump
runners.owner: R Chapman, G J Daly & R J Parks
runners.comment: Three wins last term and signed off with good third here last October; possible player
runners.spotlight: Three wins last term (5f/6f, various ground), including last spring when back from a break (albeit a shorter one than this one), and she signed off with a good third here (5f, soft) last October; possible player on return.

stable_tour.quote: She's a low-grade filly but is a little angel and could easily have won three of her last four starts. Last winter we didn't know whether to keep her in training for this season. There was probably no-one more surprised than me when she won at Redcar in May. I thought she won at Leicester at the start of the month with a little bit more up her sleeve, and to be fair to her if she'd been drawn in the middle of them at Nottingham last time she'd have won there too. She ended up on the stands' rail and didn't quite get there. I'd like to think she'll progress a little bit more, although at a low level. 28-06-24

runners.name: Ifonlytheycudtalk
runners.comment: Knocking at the door prior to winning at Beverley last September; makes reappearance
runners.spotlight: Had been knocking at the door prior to getting off the mark at the 17th attempt at Beverley (5f, good) last September; fair fifth at Southwell (5f, AW) next time; can be thereabouts if reappearing in top form.

2:02.race_name: Thank You Richard Hammill Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Strong Warrior
runners.comment: Comfortable win on debut at Ayr last July; absent since but he could be very promising
runners.spotlight: Cost 150,000gns at the breeze-ups last May and was the 5-4 favourite when a comfortable winner of a four-runner maiden on debut at Ayr (5f, good) last July; absent since and carries penalty but could be very promising.

quotes.race: Thank You Richard Hammill Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Strong Warrior probably would have needed that today. He's obviously going to come on from it and he wasn't doing an awful lost in the last furlong - he had his ears pricked - but we do think he's a nice horse - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Strong Warrior ran green in the first two furlongs, but once I asked him he's picked up really well and won like a nice horse in the making. He does know a bit but it was his first run, he'll come on for it too and there's plenty to look forward to. I've had a couple of bits of work with him and he's always shown plenty. He's fairly laid-back and won't have harm going over further, but he has the speed. He's definitely one of the nicer ones we have, for sure - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Veblen Good
runners.comment: Won at Wolverhampton on second 2yo start and he's respected under a penalty
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut at Sandown (5f, soft) last September then went one better by a nose at Wolverhampton (5f, AW); gelded since; his pedigree provides optimism he's capable of better still; respected under a penalty.

runners.name: Big Apple Jack
runners.comment: Â£8,000 yearling; half-brother to four winners but may be best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: 1,000gns foal, Â£8,000 yearling; seventh foal; Mayson half-brother to four winners notably Groupie (6f/7f; RPR 86); dam 5f winner (72); makes debut in a useful race and he may be best watched.

runners.name: Canaria Sun
runners.comment: Trainer has done well with the family but he may be one for further down the line
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; Twilight Son half-brother to winners Canaria Queen (5f/5.5f; RPR 74) and Canaria Prince (5f; 64); dam tough 5f/6f winner (98); trainer has done well with the family but he may be one for further down the line.

runners.name: Ey Up Hes A Star
runners.comment: From a family connections have done well with; probably of greater interest when h'capping
runners.spotlight: From a family connections have done well with and he showed some ability last autumn on his first two starts (6f, good to soft/soft), but he'll probably be of greater interest when handicapping after this run.

runners.name: Passchendaele
runners.comment: Half-brother to 6f winner Hougoumont (RPR 78); makes debut in good race; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; Land Force half-brother to 6f 2yo winner Hougoumont (RPR 78); dam 5f winner (84); makes debut in a good race; others preferred.

runners.name: U Sure Do
runners.comment: Placed last June on his two starts; major player if reproducing that promise on his return
runners.spotlight: Went very close at 125-1 on debut at Haydock (6f, good) last June and third in hot maiden at York (6f, good to soft) nine days later; absent since (gelded in interim); major player if reproducing that promise on return.

runners.name: William Marshal
runners.comment: Brother to two winners; he'll need to be useful if he's to make a winning debut in this
runners.spotlight: Third foal; Mayson brother to winners Amaysmont (6f-8.6f; RPR 91) and Majeur (Italian 6f/7f); he'll need to be useful if he's to make a winning debut in today's company.

runners.name: Call Me Betty
runners.comment: Faces no easy task against males on debut but trainer has won two of last three runnings
runners.spotlight: 33,000euros yearling; third foal; Sands Of Mali half-sister to 5f 2yo winner Love Wars (RPR 84); dam 6f 2yo winner (83), half-sister to two useful sprinters; faces no easy task against males on debut but trainer has won two of the last three runnings, including with a 9-1 newcomer in 2022.

3:20.race_name: Derek Cannon 80 Not Out Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Mt Fugi Park
runners.comment: Strong 3m handicap hurdle form; pulled up then sluggish in two chases; still has potential
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner; strong 3m handicap hurdle form (good to soft) last spring; pulled up on chase debut and although he jumped well at Warwick next time he was making heavy weather of it from some way out; however, he remains with potential off a good mark if fitting cheekpieces helps.

quotes.race: Next Meeting @leicesterraces Wednesday 31st January Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mt Fugi Park will get a mark after today and that'll probably direct us [where to go] a bit more. There's a three-mile race at Haydock in the middle of February that might suit him, but we won't over-face him too much this year. He'll be a nice chaser, so whatever he does going into the spring we'll be happy with, but we'll be looking forward to him next year - Jonjo O'Neill Jr, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won his first two starts over hurdles but didn't handle the heavy ground at all in the Grade 2 at Haydock in February. He then performed well at Newbury in a funny race, and was maybe a little flat on his last start at Ayr. He was always going to be a proper chaser for this season and we're looking forward to him over fences. 06-11-24

runners.name: Moon Over Mexico
runners.comment: Won Irish point; hurdle winner; pulled up/well beaten last twice; had wind op; chase debut
runners.spotlight: Dead-heated for Irish point win; winning start for yard on hurdle debut (heavy) last January; pulled up and soundly beaten in two handicap runs after but he's had wind surgery since and is not dismissed now chasing.

runners.name: Finn Lough
runners.comment: Won 2 of 3 completions in these aids but found little latest; this stiff test needs more
runners.spotlight: Has won two of three completions in these aids, at 3m on good to soft, but he found little at Southwell last time (had won there the time before) and this stiff test asks plenty on rare run away from an easy track.

quotes.race: attheraces.com/marketmovers Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Finn Lough doesn't like to be in front too soon. The thinking was to run him in a better race with more pace on. We were going quick enough and I was taking my time. I knew I'd got the horse but it was whether I could get it out of him. And today it's worked well. The cheekpieces helped but the main thing was riding him as he wanted - Henry Brooke, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: One of our better novice hurdlers for the season, he came from Harley Dunne having won his only point-to-point in Ireland. He was lucky as the two horses in front of him fell two out, but he was going just as well and everyone here seems to think he's as nice as Making Headway, if not nicer. 01-11-23

runners.name: Sean Og

prev_owners.owner: Ms Mary Mullins & Ms Margaret Mullins

runners.comment: Two good efforts at 3m (good) and 3m1f (good to soft) this season; solid chance
runners.spotlight: First two chase wins over 2m5f but he's very effective over further, as when chasing home a big improver at Hexham (3m, good) in October and winning in good style at Catterick (3m1f, good to soft) in February; fair 2m4f run in a Series Final here since; solid chance.

runners.name: Willaston
runners.comment: In good nick about this time two years ago but hasn't approached that level this season
runners.spotlight: About this time two years ago he won back-to-back Class 2 good-ground handicaps at Cheltenham (2m4f) and Haydock (3m); hasn't approached that level this season and had plenty in his favour last time at Bangor.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Long Distance Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We were surprised at Cheltenham. We thought Willaston might get a place there if we were lucky, but he finished like a train and I think this is what he wants - three miles on good ground. Jamie (Hamilton) thinks he may be a Pertemps horse. In the long-term he's a chaser. I know he fell on his chasing debut, but we can put that behind us. But what's the point at the moment when he can win hurdles like that? - Tim Walford, trainer's father.

quotes.race: Kingston Stud Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We knew Willaston was in good form coming into it and his first run of the season was great. I thought we might nick a place but I'd be lying if I thought we'd win. He's a lovely horse, his owner bought him for Â£11,000 and he's been great. He will be a chaser but whether we'll go jumping fences in the new season I'm not sure. This has topped off a wonderful season for the team - Mark Walford, trainer.

runners.name: City Derby

prev_owners.owner: Richard D A Hames & Walter O'Connor

runners.comment: Had gone off the boil when last seen and this isn't really his sort of track
runners.spotlight: Loves Cartmel where he rattled off a four-timer last summer; had gone off the boil when last seen and this isn't really his sort of track (0-3 here).

quotes.race: AF Connell Ltd Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The wind op has been a big factor. The ground being a little bit softer and no weight on City Derby's back has helped. Lizzie's done a fantastic job. It probably should have been five, I hit the front a bit too soon the first day but four is brilliant - Sean Quinlan, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Mr Yeats
runners.breeder: Mrs D Dewbery & Mrs B Woodcock
runners.comment: May need further but he makes debut for a respected new yard off an attractive mark
runners.spotlight: Won five handicap hurdles (2m4f-3m2f) for Milton Harris and ran some fair races in defeat for Harriet Dickin; may need further these days but he makes debut for a respected new yard off an attractive mark.

quotes.race: Lorna Brooke Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was my first ride for Milton. My agent Gordy [Clarkson] got me on Mr Yeats so credit to him. It was straightforward, he's very small and Milton said to me that I wouldn't have ridden anything smaller than him but he was gutsy and jumped really well - Gina Andrews, rider.

quotes.race: Try Racing TV For Free Now Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: This trip was sharp enough around here today for Mr Yeats but he toughed it out. He's still quite a young horse so hopefully there's more to come - Mitchell Bastyan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: I train all three of Va'vite's progeny, Presenting Yeats, Hasty Parisian and this fellow, and all of them have ability. He has done well this season, winning at Wincanton and Huntingdon, and is having a break until the spring. He has progressed well and will win more races. 19-01-22

runners.name: Imperial Jade
runners.comment: Has won her last two; very much a galloper so Carlisle should be up her street
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who has won her last two races (2m3f, good) and the front two came clear when doing it narrowly a month ago at Huntingdon (4lb lower); very much a galloper so Carlisle should be up her street.

runners.name: The Navigator
runners.comment: Tailed off the last twice following a break; it was a Class 2 the last time
runners.spotlight: Won twice on good ground last October (2m5f/2m4f) but has finished tailed off the last twice following a break; it was a Class 2 the last time but reservations nonetheless.

quotes.race: Go North Sea Pigeon Series Final (A Handicap Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Navigator fell in this race last year and he never really recovered. I deliberately went to Sedgefield because I thought if there was anywhere he could get his confidence back it would be there, and he needed it. He's got a lot of ability, he's a big beautiful horse, he's stunning - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

runners.name: Hourless
runners.comment: Struggles continued when only sixth of the eight runners at Hexham two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Struggles continued when only sixth of the eight runners at Hexham two weeks ago when tried in a tongue-tie; others preferred.

5:00.race_name: Racing TV 100% Profits Back To Racing Handicap Chase

runners.name: Super Citizen
runners.comment: Handily treated and best work late when close 3rd over 3m2f latest; stiff track can suit
runners.spotlight: Stout stayer who has been running on sharp tracks, doing all his best work late when a close third at Sedgefield (3m2f, good) in March; today's shorter trip isn't necessarily ideal but the stiff finish should be and he's on a handy mark now; regular cheekpieces again left off.

quotes.race: John Thomas McNamara Series (Q.R.) Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Super Citizen loves this place and the race suited him, it obviously suited him last year and suited him this year. He's not a horse that usually pulls out a lot and I'd rather have seen him two lengths clear at the last. He's honest, jumps well and stays - Eugene O'Sullivan, trainer.

runners.name: Whosmydaddy

prev_owners.owner: C Myers, Mrs S Westrope, S Andrew & T Ellis

runners.comment: Front-running wins at 3m last spring for previous yard; queries about more recent form
runners.spotlight: Front-running wins at about 3m (soft and good to soft) last spring for previous yard but pulled up on final start for them and he hasn't finished with much conviction in two runs for this stable, including over C&D.

stable_tour.quote: He was a very impressive winner of his point-to-point before joining us. He's a smashing looker who moves well, and not the type to want winter ground. We may start him off in a bumper at the Scottish National meeting, as he's owned by Jimmy Fire. He's such a nice prospect and we won't be rushing him. 06-04-23

runners.name: Gipsy Lee Rose
runners.breeder: E A R L Arnaud Vasselin
runners.comment: Has an excellent course record but suited by soft ground and rarely tackles good going now
runners.spotlight: Pulled up at Ayr last month but she has a very solid record on this track, winning over 3m2f and 2m5f; however, there is a big surface query as although a good-ground winner over hurdles she hardly ever tackles the surface now and was pulled up on it in November.

quotes.race: National Student Raceday Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: She had loads of experience and is an honest mare. The ground didn't suit her the last day and I actually think she is a far more efficient mare on better ground. She jumped well, showed a good attitude and did it well in the end. Hopefully she goes on to bigger and better things now - Shane Shortall, winning rider

stable_tour.quote: She was pulled up last week and I think she just needs soft ground these days. I think she'll go to Carlisle on the first weekend in December for a 0-105 chase over 3m2f. She won twice last season but should be a better horse than she is. Joseph O'Brien paid Â£80,000 for her and she ran in Grade 3 company in Ireland. Until the other day, she's always run her race. Her owner will keep her going as long as she's showing she still wants to do it. 21-11-24

runners.name: Limetree Boy
runners.comment: Maiden; weighted to win a race on form at about 2m1f last spring; big query over new trip
runners.spotlight: Maiden chaser; ought to have a race in him on his form at about 2m1f last spring but he's not been at that level on his last three starts and has a major trip query, having his first run beyond 2m4f over fences.

stable_tour.quote: His run at Aintree behind Hillcrest and Our Jet last season was good, as was his win at Wetherby. We'll hopefully start him off over fences at Worcester on Thursday and he's been schooling well. We're looking forward to seeing him mature over fences. 25-10-22

runners.name: Martalmixjac
runners.breeder: Mrs L & Mr J Grandchamp Des Raux
runners.comment: Handles all surfaces; back in good form on last 2 starts; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Pulled up either side of a layoff in the middle of 2024 but he's back in good form and ran an excellent race when a close second at Southwell (3m, good to soft; has won on good) in February; unraced here but has won on a stiff track; solid chance.

quotes.race: Re-Gen Waste Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Martalmix'jac hinted he's got ability many times. We've gone to the races on the back of good runs thinking, 'Today is the day', then he's put a stinker in. He seems to like it around here and has put it all together. It wasn't the strongest race, but you've still got to win them. He was going away at the line and this was probably his perfect trip. He's not one to be slogging around in the mud. He wants summer jumping, but he might be able to nick one before his season is out. He should go in again - Alex Edwards, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's turned into a really consistent campaigner, having been a little nondescript to start with. He was quite a closed book in knowing what ground he preferred and even his ideal distance, but he's turned into a very consistent sort. We can place him where he can be most competitive and he keeps pulling it out of the bag in those handicap chases around 2m4f. 16-01-25

runners.name: Coilrock
runners.comment: Irish point winner; vulnerable in handicap hurdles but this is only his 2nd chase
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner in 2022; vulnerable off modest marks in handicap hurdles but these conditions suit, and although out of the weights back from a break he's not ruled out returned to 3m in only his second chase.

runners.name: Cahiers Den
runners.comment: Irish point winner; 2nd in three of his five races over hurdles at up to 2m5f; a possible
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden point in Ireland in May 2024 (3m, good); runner-up on three of his five starts over hurdles, last time going down by 6.5l when stepped up to 2m5f at Haydock (good); a possible.

runners.name: Gone With The Tide
runners.comment: Irish point winner; has shown some promise as a hurdler but overall has a bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Won an Irish point in March last year (3m, yielding); has shown some promise over hurdles, including at 2m4f, but overall has a bit to prove.

runners.name: Iamcelestialgift
runners.breeder: T Vigneron & Messrs M & L Lochin
runners.owner: Dl Adams, Ja Adams & G Mcpherson
runners.comment: Half-brother to a bumper winner and three AQPS Flat winners; wears tongue-tie on debut
runners.spotlight: Â£28,000 3yo; half-brother to a bumper winner and three AQPS Flat winners; dam 1m4f AQPS Flat winner; quite interesting, although wears a tongue-tie for debut.

runners.name: King Coconut
runners.comment: By Yeats; modest form; step up in trip will suit but looks more one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: By Yeats; this trip should suit but only modest efforts in two runs so far; looks more one for handicaps later on.

runners.name: New Invention
runners.comment: Over 8l behind Cahier's Den on debut but no surprise if he were to reverse the form
runners.spotlight: Well related; pulled hard but nevertheless showed promise when 13.5l fourth at Newcastle on racecourse debut in February (2m1f, good to soft); was over 8l behind Cahier's Den that day but no surprise if he were to reverse the form.

runners.name: Smart Bucks
runners.comment: Modest form in bumpers and over hurdles and not one with an obvious chance
runners.spotlight: Modest form in bumpers and over hurdles; not one with an obvious chance.

runners.name: Theatre Light
runners.comment: Won Irish point on soft; faster conditions here; stable going well; worth market check
runners.spotlight: In decent form pointing in Ireland towards the end of 2023, getting off the mark on final start when winning a three-finisher 5yo mares' maiden (3m, soft); not run since; has different conditions to contend with here but stable going well and worth a market check.

runners.name: Double Digits
runners.comment: Irish point winner; beaten a nose at Newcastle last time; good chance on that form
runners.spotlight: Winning Irish pointer (3m, yielding); ran his best race over hurdles when nose second of five to a 2-7 shot at Newcastle last time (2m1f, good; 18l clear of the third); good chance on that form.

runners.name: Kabuki
runners.comment: Bumper winner; fair hurdles form; second run back after wind op; hood/tongue-tie tried
runners.spotlight: Won a good-ground bumper in December 2023; fair form over hurdles, last time finishing 16l last of four in a Sedgefield handicap (2m1f, good; pulled hard) on first run after wind surgery; hood and tongue-tie tried this time; a possible.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper on his debut and then ran a nice race at Newbury, where he wasn't right. He came back and ran a nice race at Warwick, and I'd like to think he's a good bit better than his run at Sedgefield last time. He's always worked nicely. 12-11-24

runners.name: Off To Alabama
runners.comment: Won bumper on debut; best run since when sixth on hurdles debut last time; should improve
runners.spotlight: Won a Wetherby bumper on debut in February last year (2m1f, soft); mainly disappointing since, although quite an encouraging run on hurdles debut last time; likely improver

runners.name: Kimjoy
runners.comment: Ex-Irish; ordinary form over hurdles but won a 3m point last time; stable debut
runners.spotlight: Ex-Stuart Crawford; hasn't shown a great deal over hurdles but won an Irish point when last seen out in October (3m, yielding); bit to prove back over hurdles on stable debut.

runners.name: Brindley
runners.comment: Fair at up to 1m on the Flat; better effort over jumps when fourth at Wetherby last time
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat performer at up to 1m for Jack Channon; pulled too hard on hurdles debut but better effort when fourth at Wetherby last time (2m, good; hampered by a loose horse two out); likely to improve.

stable_tour.quote: He's come to us off the Flat, where he cost a lot of money. He looks like a hurdler and will probably run at the end of January. He seems a nice type. 11-12-24

4:25.race_name: Join Racing TV Now Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Geordies Dream

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.comment: Won Kelso novice in first-time cheekpieces in May; disappointing since; visor now tried
runners.spotlight: Won a Kelso novice hurdle in first-time cheekpieces last May (2m1f, good to soft); disappointing all three starts since, the second over 2m6f on soft at Newcastle; new headgear needs to bring about improvement.

runners.name: Keepkalmandkarryon
runners.owner: Dl Adams, Ja Adams & G Mcpherson
runners.comment: Decent 20l sixth on hurdles debut; not fared as well since; interesting on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Exposed sort; far from disgraced when 20l last of six on hurdles debut at Market Rasen in October (2m4f, good); hasn't done as well since; could bounce back on this better ground on handicap debut.

runners.name: Looking Splendid
runners.comment: Maiden; good third in h'cap two runs back; chance when falling at last latest; interesting
runners.spotlight: Exposed maiden; good third in a Musselburgh handicap in February (2m4f, good to soft); in contention when coming down at the last on latest start; interesting.

runners.name: Powerofjet
runners.comment: Off the mark last time, over 2m1f here; this longer trip should suit; major contender
runners.spotlight: Off the mark when landing 2m1f handicap off a 5lb lower mark in good style here last time (good); this longer trip should suit; major contender.

runners.name: Show No Fear
runners.comment: First run over jumps since pulling up at Cartmel in May; won on Flat since; could go well
runners.spotlight: Having first run over hurdles since pulling up at Cartmel in May (2m6f, good); mixed form on the Flat since but was a 2m AW winner in February; could go well.

runners.name: Liloo Dores
runners.breeder: S C E A Des Terrains D'Avilly Saint Leon
runners.comment: Placed over hurdles; hasn't run since finishing lame in October 2022; perhaps best watched
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of her nine races over hurdles but hasn't run since finishing lame at Stratford in October 2022; on a fair mark but perhaps best watched after her long absence.

runners.name: Breadalbane Lass
runners.comment: Has improved with cheekpieces since handicapping, best run when 2nd over 2m1f here
runners.spotlight: Has improved since going handicapping with cheekpieces on, best run when 7.5l second over 2m1f here in February (good to soft); didn't fare quite as well when stepped up to 2m4f last time; each-way chance.

runners.name: Ladys Present
runners.comment: Exposed maiden; three fair runs in 2025 including over 3m latest; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Exposed maiden; three fair runs this year, including when fourth over 3m at Southwell last time; each-way chance.

runners.name: Fathers Advice
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden; has run creditably on occasions but others look stronger
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden; has run creditably on occasions, including on last two starts (1m7f/3m, good to soft/soft); 2lb wrong; others stronger.
