stable_tour.quote: He's had just a couple of runs this year. He's been a nearly horse, but he's on a ridiculously low mark now for what he shows at home. He'll probably go to the big meeting at Cartmel at the end of the month. 16-05-24

runners.name: Derracrin
runners.comment: Won a novice handicap chase at Hexham last May but has been disappointing since
runners.spotlight: Won a novice handicap chase at Hexham last May (2m4f, good) but has been disappointing since (pulled up in a C&D handicap hurdle two runs back); 3lb out of the handicap.

quotes.race: Joseph's Amazing Camels At Northumberland County Show. Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Derracrin got away with it early. He still thought he was jumping hurdles. He was a bit low but as the race went on he got better and he got more confidence in himself - Lorcan Murtagh, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

5:35.race_name: Carlisle Easter Saturday Family Extravaganza Raceday Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Im A Starman
runners.comment: Veteran; 8lb lower than for last win (3m1f, soft); handles good ground; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Veteran; 8lb lower than when winning a four-runner-handicap at Plumpton in March 2024 (3m1f, soft); fair fourth at Chepstow two runs back (2m7f, soft); handles good ground; each-way chance.

runners.name: Wee Alki
runners.comment: Improved form when second over 2m3f on h'cap debut here last time; 3m should suit
runners.spotlight: Improved form when second to a subsequent winner, clear of the rest, in a 2m3f novice on handicap debut here last time (good to soft; tongue-tie on for first time); flattered to get so close to the eased-down winner that day, but seems to stay well so this trip should suit; stable going well.

runners.name: Passengerontheship
runners.comment: Has improved since handicapping with two good runs over 2m4f; 3m should suit; chance
runners.spotlight: Has improved since going handicapping, finishing second over 2m4f at both Southwell and Newcastle on last two starts (good to soft/good); was third in a 3m point so this longer trip should suit; chance.

stable_tour.quote: Jonathan: We bought him from Irish point-to-points and he's out of a half-sister to Mwaleshi, who I used to ride, which was why we looked at him. He's taken time to get to grips with the job and is fairly unexposed. He's just qualified for a handicap mark and we hope he'll be a nice horse in time. 08-02-24

runners.name: Rob Roy Macgregor
runners.comment: Won a 2m1f bumper here; best run for a while when third over 3m last time; contender
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m1f bumper here in 2023; returned to form after two lesser runs when third in a 3m novice handicap at Ayr last time (good to soft); contender.

stable_tour.quote: He's a Walk In The Park and has not been the easiest to train. We've never worked him too hard at home as we were worried we might just blow his head a bit. It's been about getting him on a racecourse and his bumper form looks good. He won first time at Carlisle and shouldn't really have gone to Hexham after that as the course didn't really suit him. I was desperate to get another run into him because of his temperament. He pulled hard on his hurdle debut at Kelso but he jumped really well and we were delighted with his performance. Two miles will be a bit sharp for him but we might stay there to get him to settle. We won't be in a great hurry, he might have another run before Christmas and we'll see where we are in the new year. His bumper form was very good and he is exciting. 15-11-23

runners.name: Palm Beach

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: 43lb lower than last winning mark; mixed form over various trips this term; bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won for more than three years but is now rated 43lb lower; mixed form over a variety of distances this season; plenty to prove at present.

quotes.race: Scottish Racing Academy Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Palm Beach felt like he was going half-speed the whole way round and he did that well. He's been working very well and I was hopeful of a big run - John Dixon, rider.

runners.name: On We Go

prev_owners.owner: Kenny Johnson And Mrs K Elliott

runners.comment: Last win was off 22lb lower in 2023; modest efforts this term (back after wind op latest)
runners.spotlight: Last win was off a 22lb higher mark at Ayr in February 2023 (3m, soft); well beaten this season, including last time at Wetherby (3m, good) when returning after wind surgery; others stronger.

runners.name: Iturgeon Du Breuil
runners.breeder: Dr V Denis Hubert & Mr Eric Helye
runners.comment: Fair fifth at Hexham in October; below par since; going suits but hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: Fair fifth in a Hexham handicap in October (2m7f, good) but below that form since; ground will suit but hard to fancy.
